consolidating : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Consolidate
cetyl : (n.) A radical, C16H33, not yet isolated, but supposed to exist in a series of compounds homologous with the ethyl compounds, and derived from spermaceti.
crustalogical : (a.) Pertaining to crustalogy.
camerlingo : (n.) The papal chamberlain; the cardinal who presides over the pope's household. He has at times possessed great power.
centesimation : (n.) The infliction of the death penalty upon one person in every hundred, as in cases of mutiny.
croslet : (n.) See Crosslet.
cruciform : (a.) Cross-shaped; (Bot.) having four parts arranged in the form of a cross.
cramoisy : (a.) Crimson.
clearedness : (n.) The quality of being cleared.
caufle : (n.) A gang of slaves. Same as Coffle.
castanea : (n.) A genus of nut-bearing trees or shrubs including the chestnut and chinquapin.
chiliasm : (n.) The millennium. | : (n.) The doctrine of the personal reign of Christ on earth during the millennium.
corollifloral : (a.) Alt. of Corolliflorous
camphire : (n.) An old spelling of Camphor.
congregation : (n.) The act of congregating, or bringing together, or of collecting into one aggregate or mass. | : (n.) A collection or mass of separate things. | : (n.) An assembly of persons; a gathering; esp. an assembly of persons met for the worship of God, and for religious instruction; a body of people who habitually so meet. | : (n.) The whole body of the Jewish people; -- called also Congregation of the Lord. | : (n.) A body of cardinals or other ecclesiastics to whom as intrusted some department of the church business; as, the Congregation of the Propaganda, which has charge of the missions of the Roman Catholic Church. | : (n.) A company of religious persons forming a subdivision of a monastic order. | : (n.) The assemblage of Masters and Doctors at Oxford or Cambrige University, mainly for the granting of degrees. | : (n.) the name assumed by the Protestant party under John Knox. The leaders called themselves (1557) Lords of the Congregation.
cat-rigged : (a.) Rigged like a catboat.
caricatured : (imp. & p. p.) of Caricature
cantabrian : (a.) Of or pertaining to Cantabria on the Bay of Biscay in Spain.
coziness : (n.) The state or quality of being cozy.
cubeb : (n.) The small, spicy berry of a species of pepper (Piper Cubeba; in med., Cubeba officinalis), native in Java and Borneo, but now cultivated in various tropical countries. The dried unripe fruit is much used in medicine as a stimulant and purgative.
capellane : (n.) The curate of a chapel; a chaplain.
cubed : (imp. & p. p.) of Cube
cageling : (n.) A bird confined in a cage; esp. a young bird.
camous : (a.) Alt. of Camoys
chirographic : (a.) Alt. of Chirographical
consolidation : (n.) The act or process of consolidating, making firm, or uniting; the state of being consolidated; solidification; combination. | : (n.) To organic cohesion of different circled in a flower; adnation. | : (n.) The combination of several actions into one.
caving : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Cave
conjector : (n.) One who guesses or conjectures.
cuskin : (n.) A kind of drinking cup.
carlist : (n.) A partisan of Charles X. of France, or of Don Carlos of Spain.
cleistogamic : (a.) Alt. of Cleistogamous
cambrian : (a.) Of or pertaining to Cambria or Wales. | : (a.) Of or pertaining to the lowest subdivision of the rocks of the Silurian or Molluscan age; -- sometimes described as inferior to the Silurian. It is named from its development in Cambria or Wales. See the Diagram under Geology. | : (n.) A native of Cambria or Wales. | : (n.) The Cambrian formation.
cystid : (n.) One of the Cystidea.
chymify : (v. t.) To form into chyme.
cosovereign : (n.) A joint sovereign.
cystic : (a.) Having the form of, or living in, a cyst; as, the cystic entozoa. | : (a.) Containing cysts; cystose; as, cystic sarcoma. | : (a.) Pertaining to, or contained in, a cyst; esp., pertaining to, or contained in, either the urinary bladder or the gall bladder.
crow's-foot : (n.) The wrinkles that appear, as the effect of age or dissipation, under and around the outer corners of the eyes. | : (n.) A caltrop. | : (n.) Same as Bird's-mouth.
cullion : (n.) A mean wretch; a base fellow; a poltroon; a scullion.
chachalaca : (n.) The Texan guan (Ortalis vetula).
compositive : (a.) Having the quality of entering into composition; compounded.
copiousness : (n.) The state or quality of being copious; abudance; plenty; also, diffuseness in style.
coindication : (n.) One of several signs or symptoms indicating the same fact; as, a coindication of disease.
counter-courant : (a.) Running in opposite directions; -- said of animals borne in a coast of arms.
crosstrees : (n. pl.) Pieces of timber at a masthead, to which are attached the upper shrouds. At the head of lower masts in large vessels, they support a semicircular platform called the "top."
circumventing : (p. pr. vb. n.) of Circumvent
conductivity : (n.) The quality or power of conducting, or of receiving and transmitting, as heat, electricity, etc.; as, the conductivity of a nerve.
chicanery : (n.) Mean or unfair artifice to perplex a cause and obscure the truth; stratagem; sharp practice; sophistry.
conation : (n.) The power or act which directs or impels to effort of any kind, whether muscular or psychical.
cyanite : (n.) A mineral occuring in thin-bladed crystals and crystalline aggregates, of a sky-blue color. It is a silicate of aluminium.
calorifacient : (a.) See Calorificient.
charwoman : (n.) A woman hired for odd work or for single days.
cameleon : (n.) See Chaceleon.
cockscomb : (n.) See Coxcomb. | : (n.) A plant (Celosia cristata), of many varieties, cultivated for its broad, fantastic spikes of brilliant flowers; -- sometimes called garden cockscomb. Also the Pedicularis, or lousewort, the Rhinanthus Crista-galli, and the Onobrychis Crista-galli.
contesseration : (n.) An assemblage; a collection; harmonious union.
catpipe : (n.) See Catcall.
convexness : (n.) The state of being convex; convexity.
crupper : (n.) The buttocks or rump of a horse. | : (n.) A leather loop, passing under a horse's tail, and buckled to the saddle to keep it from slipping forwards. | : (v. t.) To fit with a crupper; to place a crupper upon; as, to crupper a horse.
chars-a-banc : (pl. ) of Char-a-bancs
corrodible : (a.) Capable of being corroded; corrosible.
crotcheted : (a.) Marked or measured by crotchets; having musical notation.
circumforanean : (a.) Alt. of Circumforaneous
cock-a-hoop : (a.) Boastful; defiant; exulting. Also used adverbially.
cavity : (n.) Hollowness. | : (n.) A hollow place; a hollow; as, the abdominal cavity.
coffeepot : (n.) A covered pot in which coffee is prepared, or is brought upon the table for drinking.
controversal : (a.) Turning or looking opposite ways. | : (a.) Controversial.
carpalia : (pl. ) of Carpale
chazy epoch : ( ) An epoch at the close of the Canadian period of the American Lower Silurian system; -- so named from a township in Clinton Co., New York. See the Diagram under Geology.
cladophyll : (n.) A special branch, resembling a leaf, as in the apparent foliage of the broom (Ruscus) and of the common cultivated smilax (Myrsiphillum).
combustion : (n.) The state of burning. | : (n.) The combination of a combustible with a supporter of combustion, producing heat, and sometimes both light and heat. | : (n.) Violent agitation; confusion; tumult.
coroneted : (a.) Wearing, or entitled to wear, a coronet; of noble birth or rank.
concerto : (n.) A composition (usually in symphonic form with three movements) in which one instrument (or two or three) stands out in bold relief against the orchestra, or accompaniment, so as to display its qualities or the performer's skill.
cartographical : (a.) Of or pertaining to cartography.
concretional : (a.) Concretionary.
chrysopa : (n.) A genus of neuropterous insects. See Lacewing.
chondrogenesis : (n.) The development of cartilage.
consolidative : (a.) Tending or having power to consolidate; healing.
convoluluses : (pl. ) of Convolvulus
cross-crosslet : (n.) A cross having the three upper ends crossed, so as to from three small crosses.
commence : (v. i.) To have a beginning or origin; to originate; to start; to begin. | : (v. i.) To begin to be, or to act as. | : (v. i.) To take a degree at a university. | : (v. t.) To enter upon; to begin; to perform the first act of.
copartnership : (n.) The state of being a copartner or of having a joint interest in any matter. | : (n.) A partnership or firm; as, A. and B. have this day formed a copartnership.
cheveril : (v. i.) Soft leather made of kid skin. Fig.: Used as a symbol of flexibility. | : (a.) Made of cheveril; pliant.
colophon : (n.) An inscription, monogram, or cipher, containing the place and date of publication, printer's name, etc., formerly placed on the last page of a book.
carnin : (n.) A white crystalline nitrogenous substance, found in extract of meat, and related to xanthin.
configuration : (n.) Form, as depending on the relative disposition of the parts of a thing' shape; figure. | : (n.) Relative position or aspect of the planets; the face of the horoscope, according to the relative positions of the planets at any time.
cephalon : (n.) The head.
commixion : (n.) Commixture.
circumvention : (n.) The act of prevailing over another by arts, address, or fraud; deception; fraud; imposture; delusion.
conventionalization : (n.) The act of making conventional. | : (n.) The state of being conventional.
coordinately : (adv.) In a coordinate manner.
cruset : (n.) A goldsmith's crucible or melting pot.
childly : (a.) Having the character of a child; belonging, or appropriate, to a child. | : (adv.) Like a child.
coniferous : (a.) Bearing cones, as the pine and cypress. | : (a.) Pertaining to the order Coniferae, of which the pine tree is the type.
camphine : (n.) Rectified oil of turpentine, used for burning in lamps, and as a common solvent in varnishes.
circuses : (pl. ) of Circus
cymophanous : (a.) Having a wavy, floating light; opalescent; chatoyant.
charmful : (a.) Abounding with charms.
circassian : (a.) Of or pertaining to Circassia, in Asia. | : (n.) A native or inhabitant of Circassia.
cyanosite : (n.) Native sulphate of copper. Cf. Blue vitriol, under Blue.
chrysochlore : (n.) A South African mole of the genus Chrysochloris; the golden mole, the fur of which reflects brilliant metallic hues of green and gold.
consanguined : (a.) Of kin blood; related.
chilostoma : (n. pl.) Alt. of Chilostomata
camoys : (a.) Flat; depressed; crooked; -- said only of the nose.
culling : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Cull | : (n.) The act of one who culls. | : (n.) Anything separated or selected from a mass.
commixing : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Commix
centriscoid : (a.) Allied to, or resembling, the genus Centriscus, of which the bellows fish is an example.
cowitch : (n.) See Cowhage.
celibatist : (n.) One who lives unmarried.
cloaked : (imp. & p. p.) of Cloak
cloudy : (n.) Overcast or obscured with clouds; clouded; as, a cloudy sky. | : (n.) Consisting of a cloud or clouds. | : (n.) Indicating gloom, anxiety, sullenness, or ill-nature; not open or cheerful. | : (n.) Confused; indistinct; obscure; dark. | : (n.) Lacking clearness, brightness, or luster. | : (n.) Marked with veins or sports of dark or various hues, as marble.
choler : (n.) The bile; -- formerly supposed to be the seat and cause of irascibility. | : (n.) Irritation of the passions; anger; wrath.
capsicine : (n.) A volatile alkaloid extracted from Capsicum annuum or from capsicin.
cuban : (a.) Of or pertaining to Cuba or its inhabitants. | : (n.) A native or an inhabitant of Cuba.
chirographer : (n.) One who practice the art or business of writing or engrossing. | : (n.) See chirographist, 2.
countersink : (v. t.) To chamfer or form a depression around the top of (a hole in wood, metal, etc.) for the reception of the head of a screw or bolt below the surface, either wholly or in part; as, to countersink a hole for a screw. | : (v. t.) To cause to sink even with or below the surface; as, to countersink a screw or bolt into woodwork. | : (n.) An enlargement of the upper part of a hole, forming a cavity or depression for receiving the head of a screw or bolt. | : (n.) A drill or cutting tool for countersinking holes.
cysted : (a.) Inclosed in a cyst.
conjunctiveness : (n.) The state or quality of being conjunctive.
coalfish : (n.) The pollock; -- called also, coalsey, colemie, colmey, coal whiting, etc. See Pollock. | : (n.) The beshow or candlefish of Alaska. | : (n.) The cobia.
calamine : (n.) A mineral, the hydrous silicate of zinc.
communist : (n.) An advocate for the theory or practice of communism. | : (n.) A supporter of the commune of Paris.
caperer : (n.) One who capers, leaps, and skips about, or dances.
clotty : (n.) Full of clots, or clods.
cruelties : (pl. ) of Cruelty
centare : (n.) A measure of area, the hundredth part of an are; one square meter, or about 1/ square yards.
contravening : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Contravene
canular : (a.) Alt. of Canulated
centumvir : (n.) One of a court of about one hundred judges chosen to try civil suits. Under the empire the court was increased to 180, and met usually in four sections.
chimera : (n.) A monster represented as vomiting flames, and as having the head of a lion, the body of a goat, and the tail of a dragon. | : (n.) A vain, foolish, or incongruous fancy, or creature of the imagination; as, the chimera of an author.
calamint : (n.) A genus of perennial plants (Calamintha) of the Mint family, esp. the C. Nepeta and C. Acinos, which are called also basil thyme.
coursing : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Course | : (n.) The pursuit or running game with dogs that follow by sight instead of by scent.
chimere : (n.) The upper robe worn by a bishop, to which lawn sleeves are usually attached.
chromatography : (n.) A treatise on colors
chiroplast : (n.) An instrument to guid the hands and fingers of pupils in playing on the piano, etc.
cuprum : (n.) Copper.
cauliform : (a.) Having the form of a caulis.
corniferous : (a.) Of or pertaining to the lowest period of the Devonian age. (See the Diagram, under Geology.) The Corniferous period has been so called from the numerous seams of hornstone which characterize the later part of the period, as developed in the State of New York.
creatural : (a.) Belonging to a creature; having the qualities of a creature.
corticated : (a.) Having a special outer covering of a nature unlike the interior part.
cottrel : (n.) A trammel, or hook to support a pot over a fire.
catechisation : (n.) The act of catechising.
coevous : (a.) Coeval
cranioscopist : (n.) One skilled in, or who practices, cranioscopy.
conundrum : (n.) A kind of riddle based upon some fanciful or fantastic resemblance between things quite unlike; a puzzling question, of which the answer is or involves a pun. | : (n.) A question to which only a conjectural answer can be made.
congenerous : (a.) Allied in origin or cause; congeneric; as, congenerous diseases.
community : (n.) Common possession or enjoyment; participation; as, a community of goods. | : (n.) A body of people having common rights, privileges, or interests, or living in the same place under the same laws and regulations; as, a community of monks. Hence a number of animals living in a common home or with some apparent association of interests. | : (n.) Society at large; a commonwealth or state; a body politic; the public, or people in general. | : (n.) Common character; likeness. | : (n.) Commonness; frequency.
clodhopper : (n.) A rude, rustic fellow.
consimilitude : (n.) Alt. of Consimility
cylindriform : (a.) Having the form of a cylinder.
cocoa : ( ) Alt. of Cocoa palm | : (n.) A preparation made from the seeds of the chocolate tree, and used in making, a beverage; also the beverage made from cocoa or cocoa shells.
coeval : (n.) Of the same age; existing during the same period of time, especially time long and remote; -- usually followed by with. | : (n.) One of the same age; a contemporary.
calamus : (n.) The indian cane, a plant of the Palm family. It furnishes the common rattan. See Rattan, and Dragon's blood. | : (n.) A species of Acorus (A. calamus), commonly called calamus, or sweet flag. The root has a pungent, aromatic taste, and is used in medicine as a stomachic; the leaves have an aromatic odor, and were formerly used instead of rushes to strew on floors. | : (n.) The horny basal portion of a feather; the barrel or quill.
capered : (imp. & p. p.) of Caper
coaita : (n.) The native name of certain South American monkeys of the genus Ateles, esp. A. paniscus. The black-faced coaita is Ateles ater. See Illustration in Appendix.
catapuce : (n.) Spurge.
cubing : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Cube
consented : (imp. & p. p.) of Consent
countershaft : (n.) An intermediate shaft; esp., one which receives motion from a line shaft in a factory and transmits it to a machine.
consenter : (a.) One who consents.
coronach : (n.) See Coranach.
centrum : (n.) The body, or axis, of a vertebra. See Vertebra.
corked : (imp. & p. p.) of Cork | : (a.) having acquired an unpleasant taste from the cork; as, a bottle of wine is corked.
craniofacial : (a.) Of or pertaining to the cranium and face; as, the craniofacial angle.
confiding : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Confide | : (a.) That confides; trustful; unsuspicious.
cede : (v. t.) To yield or surrender; to give up; to resign; as, to cede a fortress, a province, or country, to another nation, by treaty.
chelifer : (n.) See Book scorpion, under Book.
currier : (n.) One who curries and dresses leather, after it is tanned.
compone : (v. t.) To compose; to settle; to arrange. | : (a.) See Compony. | : (a.) Divided into squares of alternate tinctures in a single row; -- said of any bearing; or, in the case of a bearing having curved lines, divided into patches of alternate colors following the curve. If there are two rows it is called counter-compony.
cowish : (v. t.) Timorous; fearful; cowardly. | : (n.) An umbelliferous plant (Peucedanum Cous) with edible tuberous roots, found in Oregon.
clamorous : (a.) Speaking and repeating loud words; full of clamor; calling or demanding loudly or urgently; vociferous; noisy; bawling; loud; turbulent.
chargeableness : (n.) The quality of being chargeable or expensive.
concordancy : (n.) Agreement.
corindon : (n.) See Corrundum.
cessionary : (a.) Having surrendered the effects; as, a cessionary bankrupt.
coryphaenoid : (a.) Belonging to, or like, the genus Coryphaena. See Dolphin.
chorography : (n.) the mapping or description of a region or district.
circumciser : (n.) One who performs circumcision.
catastrophic : (a.) Of a pertaining to a catastrophe.
columbine : (a.) Of or pertaining to a dove; dovelike; dove-colored. | : (n.) A plant of several species of the genus Aquilegia; as, A. vulgaris, or the common garden columbine; A. Canadensis, the wild red columbine of North America. | : (n.) The mistress or sweetheart of Harlequin in pantomimes.
crenated : (a.) Having the margin cut into rounded teeth notches, or scallops.
crustaceousness : (n.) The state or quality of being crustaceous or having a crustlike shell.
clannish : (a.) Of or pertaining to a clan; closely united, like a clan; disposed to associate only with one's clan or clique; actuated by the traditions, prejudices, habits, etc., of a clan.
cisco : (n.) The Lake herring (Coregonus Artedi), valuable food fish of the Great Lakes of North America. The name is also applied to C. Hoyi, a related species of Lake Michigan.
confated : (p.a.) Fated or decreed with something else.
circumcised : (imp. & p. p.) of Circumcise
cultivated : (imp. & p. p.) of Cultivate
controversor : (n.) A controverser.
cretin : (n.) One afflicted with cretinism.
cruciferous : (a.) Bearing a cross. | : (a.) Of, pertaining to, or resembling, a family of plants which have four petals arranged like the arms of a cross, as the mustard, radish, turnip, etc.
chrysography : (n.) The art of writing in letters of gold. | : (n.) A writing executed in letters of gold.
cardigan jacket : ( ) A warm jacket of knit worsted with or without sleeves.
condensible : (a.) Capable of being condensed; as, a gas condensible to a liquid by cold.
cruising : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Cruise
cuticular : (a.) Pertaining to the cuticle, or external coat of the skin; epidermal.
couvade : (n.) A custom, among certain barbarous tribes, that when a woman gives birth to a child her husband takes to his bed, as if ill.
characterize : (v. t.) To make distinct and recognizable by peculiar marks or traits; to make with distinctive features. | : (v. t.) To engrave or imprint. | : (v. t.) To indicate the character of; to describe. | : (v. t.) To be a characteristic of; to make, or express the character of.
circumgestation : (n.) The act or process of carrying about.
coestate : (n.) Joint estate.
carburize : (v. t.) To combine with carbon or a carbon compound; -- said esp. of a process for conferring a higher degree of illuminating power on combustible gases by mingling them with a vapor of volatile hydrocarbons.
conversationed : (a.) Acquainted with manners and deportment; behaved.
callosities : (pl. ) of Callosity
communism : (n.) A scheme of equalizing the social conditions of life; specifically, a scheme which contemplates the abolition of inequalities in the possession of property, as by distributing all wealth equally to all, or by holding all wealth in common for the equal use and advantage of all.
catsos : (pl. ) of Catso
conjoined : (imp. & p. p.) of Conjoin | : (a.) Joined together or touching.
curried : (n.) Dressed by currying; cleaned; prepared. | : (n.) Prepared with curry; as, curried rice, fowl, etc. | : (imp. & p. p.) of Curry
contractibility : (n.) Capability of being contracted; quality of being contractible; as, the contractibility and dilatability of air.
centinody : (n.) A weed with a stem of many joints (Illecebrum verticillatum); also, the Polygonum aviculare or knotgrass.
chartography : (n.) Same as Cartographer, Cartographic, Cartography, etc.
cocky : (a.) Pert.
collyria : (pl. ) of Collyrium
copartneries : (pl. ) of Copartnery
communion : (n.) The act of sharing; community; participation. | : (n.) Intercourse between two or more persons; esp., intimate association and intercourse implying sympathy and confidence; interchange of thoughts, purposes, etc.; agreement; fellowship; as, the communion of saints. | : (n.) A body of Christians having one common faith and discipline; as, the Presbyterian communion. | : (n.) The sacrament of the eucharist; the celebration of the Lord's supper; the act of partaking of the sacrament; as, to go to communion; to partake of the communion.
chloropeptic : (a.) Of or pertaining to an acid more generally called pepsin-hydrochloric acid.
caked : (imp. & p. p.) of Cake
centumviral : (a.) Of or pertaining to the centumviri, or to a centumvir.
caddie : (n.) A Scotch errand boy, porter, or messenger.

conchite : (n.) A fossil or petrified conch or shell.
chaser : (n.) One who or that which chases; a pursuer; a driver; a hunter. | : (n.) Same as Chase gun, esp. in terms bow chaser and stern chaser. See under Bow, Stern. | : (n.) One who chases or engraves. See 5th Chase, and Enchase. | : (n.) A tool with several points, used for cutting or finishing screw threads, either external or internal, on work revolving in a lathe.
circumstantiate : (v. t.) To place in particular circumstances; to invest with particular accidents or adjuncts. | : (v. t.) To prove or confirm by circumstances; to enter into details concerning.
confirmable : (a.) That may be confirmed.
cappadine : (n.) A floss or waste obtained from the cocoon after the silk has been reeled off, used for shag.
corruptress : (n.) A woman who corrupts.
cottage : (n.) A small house; a cot; a hut.
consecutiveness : (n.) The state or quality of being consecutive.

cretor : (n.) One who creates, produces, or constitutes. Specifically, the Supreme Being.

canada : (n.) A British province in North America, giving its name to various plants and animals.
crawling : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Crawl
consummately : (adv.) In a consummate manner; completely.
concordance : (n.) Agreement; accordance. | : (n.) Concord; agreement. | : (n.) An alphabetical verbal index showing the places in the text of a book where each principal word may be found, with its immediate context in each place. | : (n.) A topical index or orderly analysis of the contents of a book.
carmot : (n.) The matter of which the philosopher's stone was believed to be composed.
catsup : (n.) A table sauce made from mushrooms, tomatoes, walnuts, etc. | : (n.) Same as Catchup, and Ketchup.
companion : (n.) One who accompanies or is in company with another for a longer or shorter period, either from choice or casually; one who is much in the company of, or is associated with, another or others; an associate; a comrade; a consort; a partner. | : (n.) A knight of the lowest rank in certain orders; as, a companion of the Bath. | : (n.) A fellow; -- in contempt. | : (n.) A skylight on an upper deck with frames and sashes of various shapes, to admit light to a cabin or lower deck. | : (n.) A wooden hood or penthouse covering the companion way; a companion hatch. | : (v. t.) To be a companion to; to attend on; to accompany. | : (v. t.) To qualify as a companion; to make equal.
calamite : (n.) A fossil plant of the coal formation, having the general form of plants of the modern Equiseta (the Horsetail or Scouring Rush family) but sometimes attaining the height of trees, and having the stem more or less woody within. See Acrogen, and Asterophyllite.
colloquist : (n.) A speaker in a colloquy or dialogue.
complained : (imp. & p. p.) of Complain
copeck : (n.) A Russian copper coin. See Kopeck.
collectivism : (n.) The doctrine that land and capital should be owned by society collectively or as a whole; communism.
collied : (p. & a.) Darkened. See Colly, v. t. | : (imp. & p. p.) of Colly
continuate : (a.) Immediately united together; intimately connected. | : (a.) Uninterrupted; unbroken; continual; continued.
choregraphy : (n.) The art of representing dancing by signs, as music is represented by notes.
costively : (adv.) In a costive manner.
cheering : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Cheer
corradiate : (v. t.) To converge to one point or focus, as light or rays.
calamity : (n.) Any great misfortune or cause of misery; -- generally applied to events or disasters which produce extensive evil, either to communities or individuals. | : (n.) A state or time of distress or misfortune; misery.
cartage : (n.) The act of carrying in a cart. | : (n.) The price paid for carting.
collectivist : (n.) An advocate of collectivism. | : (a.) Relating to, or characteristic of, collectivism.
constituent : (a.) Serving to form, compose, or make up; elemental; component. | : (a.) Having the power of electing or appointing. | : (n.) The person or thing which constitutes, determines, or constructs. | : (n.) That which constitutes or composes, as a part, or an essential part; a component; an element. | : (n.) One for whom another acts; especially, one who is represented by another in a legislative assembly; -- correlative to representative. | : (n.) A person who appoints another to act for him as attorney in fact.
complainer : (n.) One who complains or laments; one who finds fault; a murmurer.
cordovan : (n.) Same as Cordwain. In England the name is applied to leather made from horsehide.
collocution : (n.) A speaking or conversing together; conference; mutual discourse.
communing : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Commune
confiscatory : (a.) Effecting confiscation; characterized by confiscations.
cultrivorous : (a.) Devouring knives; swallowing, or pretending to swallow, knives; -- applied to persons who have swallowed, or have seemed to swallow, knives with impunity.
cipher : (n.) A character [0] which, standing by itself, expresses nothing, but when placed at the right hand of a whole number, increases its value tenfold. | : (n.) One who, or that which, has no weight or influence. | : (n.) A character in general, as a figure or letter. | : (n.) A combination or interweaving of letters, as the initials of a name; a device; a monogram; as, a painter's cipher, an engraver's cipher, etc. The cut represents the initials N. W. | : (n.) A private alphabet, system of characters, or other mode of writing, contrived for the safe transmission of secrets; also, a writing in such characters. | : (a.) Of the nature of a cipher; of no weight or influence. | : (v. i.) To use figures in a mathematical process; to do sums in arithmetic. | : (v. t.) To write in occult characters. | : (v. t.) To get by ciphering; as, to cipher out the answer. | : (v. t.) To decipher. | : (v. t.) To designate by characters.
chased : (imp. & p. p.) of Chase
cremation : (n.) A burning; esp., the act or practice of cremating the dead.
chrismation : (n.) The act of applying the chrism, or consecrated oil.
coquettish : (a.) Practicing or exhibiting coquetry; alluring; enticing.
cyanurate : (n.) A salt of cyanuric acid.
charted : (imp. & p. p.) of Chart
contempt : (n.) The act of contemning or despising; the feeling with which one regards that which is esteemed mean, vile, or worthless; disdain; scorn. | : (n.) The state of being despised; disgrace; shame. | : (n.) An act or expression denoting contempt. | : (n.) Disobedience of the rules, orders, or process of a court of justice, or of rules or orders of a legislative body; disorderly, contemptuous, or insolent language or behavior in presence of a court, tending to disturb its proceedings, or impair the respect due to its authority.
cheerily : (adv.) In a cheery manner.
calamist : (n.) One who plays upon a reed or pipe.
codetta : (n.) A short passage connecting two sections, but not forming part of either; a short coda.
calmness : (n.) The state of quality of being calm; quietness; tranquillity; self-repose.
crefting : (n.) Croftland. | : (n.) Exposing linen to the sun, on the grass, in the process of bleaching.
cubile : (n.) The lowest course of stones in a building.
collier : (n.) One engaged in the business of digging mineral coal or making charcoal, or in transporting or dealing in coal. | : (n.) A vessel employed in the coal trade.
carbonadoed : (imp. & p. p.) of Carbonade
collusory : (a.) Collusive.
contourne' : (a.) Turned in a direction which is not the usual one; -- said of an animal turned to the sinister which is usually turned to the dexter, or the like.
causeuse : (n.) A kind of sofa for two persons. A tete-/-tete.
collingly : (adv.) With embraces.
cupolas : (pl. ) of Cupola
called : (imp. & p. p.) of Call
canniness : (n.) Caution; crafty management.
churchman : (n.) An ecclesiastic or clergyman. | : (n.) An Episcopalian, or a member of the Established Church of England. | : (n.) One was is attached to, or attends, church.
charter : (n.) A written evidence in due form of things done or granted, contracts made, etc., between man and man; a deed, or conveyance. | : (n.) An instrument in writing, from the sovereign power of a state or country, executed in due form, bestowing rights, franchises, or privileges. | : (n.) An act of a legislative body creating a municipal or other corporation and defining its powers and privileges. Also, an instrument in writing from the constituted authorities of an order or society (as the Freemasons), creating a lodge and defining its powers. | : (n.) A special privilege, immunity, or exemption. | : (n.) The letting or hiring a vessel by special contract, or the contract or instrument whereby a vessel is hired or let; as, a ship is offered for sale or charter. See Charter party, below. | : (v. t.) To establish by charter. | : (v. t.) To hire or let by charter, as a ship. See Charter party, under Charter, n.
compost : (n.) A mixture; a compound. | : (n.) A mixture for fertilizing land; esp., a composition of various substances (as muck, mold, lime, and stable manure) thoroughly mingled and decomposed, as in a compost heap. | : (v. t.) To manure with compost. | : (v. t.) To mingle, as different fertilizing substances, in a mass where they will decompose and form into a compost.
collieries : (pl. ) of Colliery
corposant : (n.) St. Elmo's fire. See under Saint.
cumulated : (imp. & p. p.) of Cumulate
coenosarc : (n.) The common soft tissue which unites the polyps of a compound hydroid. See Hydroidea.
carbonadoes : (pl. ) of Carbonado
commercing : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Commerce
cornmuse : (n.) A cornemuse.
chawdron : (n.) Entrails.
compote : (n.) A preparation of fruit in sirup in such a manner as to preserve its form, either whole, halved, or quartered; as, a compote of pears.
concause : (n.) A joint cause.
crimpage : (n.) The act or practice of crimping; money paid to a crimp for shipping or enlisting men.
croton bug : ( ) A small, active, winged species of cockroach (Ectobia Germanica), the water bug. It is common aboard ships, and in houses in cities, esp. in those with hot-water pipes.
chirurgical : (a.) Surgical
columbite : (n.) A mineral of a black color, submetallic luster, and high specific specific gravity. It is a niobate (or columbate) of iron and manganese, containing tantalate of iron; -- first found in New England.
crookack : (a.) Hunched.
crinose : (a.) Hairy.
chucking : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Chuck | : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Chuck
clodhopping : (a.) Boorish; rude.
contradict : (v. t.) To assert the contrary of; to oppose in words; to take issue with; to gainsay; to deny the truth of, as of a statement or a speaker; to impugn. | : (v. t.) To be contrary to; to oppose; to resist. | : (v. i.) To oppose in words; to gainsay; to deny, or assert the contrary of, something.
comport : (v. i.) To bear or endure; to put up (with); as, to comport with an injury. | : (v. i.) To agree; to accord; to suit; -- sometimes followed by with. | : (v. t.) To bear; to endure; to brook; to put with. | : (v. t.) To carry; to conduct; -- with a reflexive pronoun. | : (n.) Manner of acting; behavior; conduct; deportment.
cultivator : (n.) One who cultivates; as, a cultivator of the soil; a cultivator of literature. | : (n.) An agricultural implement used in the tillage of growing crops, to loosen the surface of the earth and kill the weeds; esp., a triangular frame set with small shares, drawn by a horse and by handles.
carriable : (a.) Capable of being carried.
ceil : (v. t.) To overlay or cover the inner side of the roof of; to furnish with a ceiling; as, to ceil a room. | : (v. t.) To line or finish a surface, as of a wall, with plaster, stucco, thin boards, or the like.
classifying : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Classify
comported : (imp. & p. p.) of Comport
colonizationist : (n.) A friend to colonization, esp. (U. S. Hist) to the colonization of Africa by emigrants from the colored population of the United States.
cockweed : (n.) Peppergrass.
converge : (v. i.) To tend to one point; to incline and approach nearer together; as, lines converge. | : (v. t.) To cause to tend to one point; to cause to incline and approach nearer together.
cowing : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Cow
compose : (v. t.) To form by putting together two or more things or parts; to put together; to make up; to fashion. | : (v. t.) To form the substance of, or part of the substance of; to constitute. | : (v. t.) To construct by mental labor; to design and execute, or put together, in a manner involving the adaptation of forms of expression to ideas, or to the laws of harmony or proportion; as, to compose a sentence, a sermon, a symphony, or a picture. | : (v. t.) To dispose in proper form; to reduce to order; to put in proper state or condition; to adjust; to regulate. | : (v. t.) To free from agitation or disturbance; to tranquilize; to soothe; to calm; to quiet. | : (v. t.) To arrange (types) in a composing stick in order for printing; to set (type). | : (v. i.) To come to terms.
couche : (v. t.) Not erect; inclined; -- said of anything that is usually erect, as an escutcheon. | : (v. t.) Lying on its side; thus, a chevron couche is one which emerges from one side of the escutcheon and has its apex on the opposite side, or at the fess point.
charming : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Charm | : (a.) Pleasing the mind or senses in a high degree; delighting; fascinating; attractive.
coyote : (n.) A carnivorous animal (Canis latrans), allied to the dog, found in the western part of North America; -- called also prairie wolf. Its voice is a snapping bark, followed by a prolonged, shrill howl.
columbium : (n.) A rare element of the vanadium group, first found in a variety of the mineral columbite occurring in Connecticut, probably at Haddam. Atomic weight 94.2. Symbol Cb or Nb. Now more commonly called niobium.
chthonophagia : (n.) Alt. of Chthonophagy
cymric : (a.) Welsh. | : (n.) The Welsh language.
carpetbagger : (n.) An adventurer; -- a term of contempt for a Northern man seeking private gain or political advancement in the southern part of the United States after the Civil War (1865).
chasse : (n.) A movement in dancing, as across or to the right or left. | : (v. i.) To make the movement called chasse; as, all chasse; chasse to the right or left.
characterism : (n.) A distinction of character; a characteristic.
calvinistical : (a.) Of or pertaining to Calvin, or Calvinism; following Calvin; accepting or Teaching Calvinism.
curtail dog : ( ) A dog with a docked tail; formerly, the dog of a person not qualified to course, which, by the forest laws, must have its tail cut short, partly as a mark, and partly from a notion that the tail is necessary to a dog in running; hence, a dog not fit for sporting.
concupiscibleness : (n.) The state of being concupiscible.
celt : (n.) One of an ancient race of people, who formerly inhabited a great part of Central and Western Europe, and whose descendants at the present day occupy Ireland, Wales, the Highlands of Scotland, and the northern shores of France. | : (n.) A weapon or implement of stone or metal, found in the tumuli, or barrows, of the early Celtic nations.
concurrentness : (n.) The state or quality of being concurrent; concurrence.
cream-slice : (n.) A wooden knife with a long thin blade, used in handling cream or ice cream.
conventicler : (n.) One who supports or frequents conventicles.
copelata : (n. pl.) See Larvalla.
cell : (n.) A very small and close apartment, as in a prison or in a monastery or convent; the hut of a hermit. | : (n.) A small religious house attached to a monastery or convent. | : (n.) Any small cavity, or hollow place. | : (n.) The space between the ribs of a vaulted roof. | : (n.) Same as Cella. | : (n.) A jar of vessel, or a division of a compound vessel, for holding the exciting fluid of a battery. | : (n.) One of the minute elementary structures, of which the greater part of the various tissues and organs of animals and plants are composed. | : (v. t.) To place or inclose in a cell.
conversancy : (n.) Conversance
cosmogony : (n.) The creation of the world or universe; a theory or account of such creation; as, the poetical cosmogony of Hesoid; the cosmogonies of Thales, Anaxagoras, and Plato.
cuerpo : (n.) The body.
calcinable : (a.) That may be calcined; as, a calcinable fossil.
cribbing : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Crib | : (n.) The act of inclosing or confining in a crib or in close quarters. | : (n.) Purloining; stealing; plagiarizing. | : (n.) A framework of timbers and plank backing for a shaft lining, to prevent caving, percolation of water, etc. | : (n.) A vicious habit of a horse; crib-biting. The horse lays hold of the crib or manger with his teeth and draws air into the stomach with a grunting sound.
chancellorship : (n.) The office of a chancellor; the time during which one is chancellor.
cataclysm : (n.) An extensive overflow or sweeping flood of water; a deluge. | : (n.) Any violent catastrophe, involving sudden and extensive changes of the earth's surface.
conservant : (a.) Having the power or quality of conservation.
climbed : (imp. & p. p.) of Climb
conversance : (n.) The state or quality of being conversant; habit of familiarity; familiar acquaintance; intimacy.
confoundedly : (adv.) Extremely; odiously; detestable.

cucurbit : (n.) Alt. of Cucurbite
clean-limbed : (a.) With well-proportioned, unblemished limbs; as, a clean-limbed young fellow.

compassionateness : (n.) The quality or state of being compassionate.
crucifixion : (n.) The act of nailing or fastening a person to a cross, for the purpose of putting him to death; the use of the cross as a method of capital punishment. | : (n.) The state of one who is nailed or fastened to a cross; death upon a cross. | : (n.) Intense suffering or affliction; painful trial.
callat : (n.) Same as Callet.
chairman : (n.) The presiding officer of a committee, or of a public or private meeting, or of any organized body. | : (n.) One whose business it is to cary a chair or sedan.
climber : (n.) One who, or that which, climbs | : (n.) A plant that climbs. | : (n.) A bird that climbs, as a woodpecker or a parrot. | : (v. i.) To climb; to mount with effort; to clamber.
contradistinction : (n.) Distinction by contrast.
chout : (n.) An assessment equal to a fourth part of the revenue.
clanship : (n.) A state of being united together as in a clan; an association under a chieftain.
coneine : (n.) See Conine.
cretan : (a.) Pertaining to Crete, or Candia. | : (n.) A native or inhabitant of Crete or Candia.
crannog : (n.) Alt. of Crannoge
confervae : (pl. ) of Conferva
caroched : (a.) Placed in a caroche.
caduke : (a.) Perishable; frail; transitory.
caddis : (n.) The larva of a caddice fly. These larvae generally live in cylindrical cases, open at each end, and covered externally with pieces of broken shells, gravel, bits of wood, etc. They are a favorite bait with anglers. Called also caddice worm, or caddis worm. | : (n.) A kind of worsted lace or ribbon.
carburization : (n.) The act, process, or result of carburizing.
cro-quette : (n.) A ball of minced meat, fowl, rice, or other ingredients, highly seasoned, and fried.
callid : (a.) Characterized by cunning or shrewdness; crafty.
cavies : (pl. ) of Cavy
curvicostate : (a.) Having bent ribs.
cent : (n.) A hundred; as, ten per cent, the proportion of ten parts in a hundred. | : (n.) A United States coin, the hundredth part of a dollar, formerly made of copper, now of copper, tin, and zinc. | : (n.) An old game at cards, supposed to be like piquet; -- so called because 100 points won the game.
cephalad : (adv.) Forwards; towards the head or anterior extremity of the body; opposed to caudad.
chargehouse : (n.) A schoolhouse.
condensative : (a.) Having the property of condensing.
chops : (n. pl.) The jaws; also, the fleshy parts about the mouth. | : (n. pl.) The sides or capes at the mouth of a river, channel, harbor, or bay; as, the chops of the English Channel.
crataegus : (n.) A genus of small, hardy trees, including the hawthorn, much used for ornamental purposes.
cubless : (a.) Having no cubs.
crebrisulcate : (a.) Marked with closely set transverse furrows.
clericalism : (n.) An excessive devotion to the interests of the sacerdotal order; undue influence of the clergy; sacerdotalism.
chasmy : (a.) Of or pertaining to a chasm; abounding in chasms.
cabalistic : (a.) Alt. of Cabalistical
cascabel : (n.) The projection in rear of the breech of a cannon, usually a knob or breeching loop connected with the gun by a neck. In old writers it included all in rear of the base ring. [See Illust. of Cannon.]
churchmen : (pl. ) of Churchman
campbellite : (n.) A member of the denomination called Christians or Disciples of Christ. They themselves repudiate the term Campbellite as a nickname. See Christian, 3.
cupric : (a.) Of, pertaining to, or derived from, copper; containing copper; -- said of those compounds of copper in which this element is present in its lowest proportion.
cretic : (n.) A poetic foot, composed of one short syllable between two long ones (- / -).
cribriform : (a.) Resembling, or having the form of, a sieve; pierced with holes; as, the cribriform plate of the ethmoid bone; a cribriform compress.
compliantly : (adv.) In a compliant manner.
copland : (n.) A piece of ground terminating in a point or acute angle.
contuse : (v. t.) To beat, pound, or together. | : (v. t.) To bruise; to injure or disorganize a part without breaking the skin.
charlatan : (n.) One who prates much in his own favor, and makes unwarrantable pretensions; a quack; an impostor; an empiric; a mountebank.

chironomy : (n.) The art of moving the hands in oratory or in pantomime; gesture
cocci : (pl. ) of Coccus
circumventor : (n.) One who circumvents; one who gains his purpose by cunning.
contradistinctive : (a.) having the quality of contradistinction; distinguishing by contrast.
close-bodied : (a.) Fitting the body exactly; setting close, as a garment.
cespitose : (a.) Having the form a piece of turf, i. e., many stems from one rootstock or from many entangled rootstocks or roots.
charivari : (n.) A mock serenade of discordant noises, made with kettles, tin horns, etc., designed to annoy and insult.
centric : (a.) Alt. of Centrical
crenelation : (n.) The act of crenelating, or the state of being crenelated; an indentation or an embrasure.
condescension : (n.) The act of condescending; voluntary descent from one's rank or dignity in intercourse with an inferior; courtesy toward inferiors.
cereus : (n.) A genus of plants of the Cactus family. They are natives of America, from California to Chili.
cinnabar : (n.) Red sulphide of mercury, occurring in brilliant red crystals, and also in red or brown amorphous masses. It is used in medicine. | : (n.) The artificial red sulphide of mercury used as a pigment; vermilion.
calcimine : (n.) A white or colored wash for the ceiling or other plastering of a room, consisting of a mixture of clear glue, Paris white or zinc white, and water. | : (v. t.) To wash or cover with calcimine; as, to calcimine walls.
cappeline : (n.) A hood-shaped bandage for the head, the shoulder, or the stump of an amputated limb.
chose : (imp.) of Choose | : ( ) of Choose | : (n.) A thing; personal property. | : ( ) imp. & p. p. of Choose.
commensurate : (v. t.) To reduce to a common measure. | : (v. t.) To proportionate; to adjust. | : (a.) Having a common measure; commensurable; reducible to a common measure; as, commensurate quantities. | : (a.) Equal in measure or extent; proportionate.
christocentric : (a.) Making Christ the center, about whom all things are grouped, as in religion or history; tending toward Christ, as the central object of thought or emotion.
connature : (n.) Participation in a common nature or character.
cutinization : (n.) The conversion of cell walls into a material which repels water, as in cork.
colling : (v. t.) An embrace; dalliance.
cow tree : ( ) A tree (Galactodendron utile or Brosimum Galactodendron) of South America, which yields, on incision, a nourishing fluid, resembling milk.

colline : (n.) A small hill or mount.

corollet : (n.) A floret in an aggregate flower.
cross-spale : (n.) Alt. of Cross-spall
chondrule : (n.) A peculiar rounded granule of some mineral, usually enstatite or chrysolite, found imbedded more or less abundantly in the mass of many meteoric stones, which are hence called chondrites.
chairmen : (pl. ) of Chairman
chaunterie : (n.) See Chantry.

cross-spall : (n.) One of the temporary wooden braces, placed horizontally across a frame to hold it in position until the deck beams are in; a cross-pawl.
cervus : (n.) A genus of ruminants, including the red deer and other allied species.
centage : (n.) Rate by the hundred; percentage.
caller : (n.) One who calls. | : (a.) Cool; refreshing; fresh; as, a caller day; the caller air. | : (a.) Fresh; in good condition; as, caller berrings.
chalaza : (n.) The place on an ovule, or seed, where its outer coats cohere with each other and the nucleus. | : (n.) A spiral band of thickened albuminous substance which exists in the white of the bird's egg, and serves to maintain the yolk in its position; the treadle.
callet : (n.) A trull or prostitute; a scold or gossip. | : (v. i.) To rail or scold.
cypriot : (n.) A native or inhabitant of Cyprus.
chalaze : (n.) Same as Chalaza.

chord : (n.) The string of a musical instrument. | : (n.) A combination of tones simultaneously performed, producing more or less perfect harmony, as, the common chord. | : (n.) A right line uniting the extremities of the arc of a circle or curve. | : (n.) A cord. See Cord, n., 4. | : (n.) The upper or lower part of a truss, usually horizontal, resisting compression or tension. | : (v. t.) To provide with musical chords or strings; to string; to tune. | : (v. i.) To accord; to harmonize together; as, this note chords with that.
chore : (n.) A small job; in the pl., the regular or daily light work of a household or farm, either within or without doors. | : (v. i.) To do chores. | : (n.) A choir or chorus.
catch-meadow : (n.) A meadow irrigated by water from a spring or rivulet on the side of hill.
caviar : (n.) The roes of the sturgeon, prepared and salted; -- used as a relish, esp. in Russia.
capriped : (a.) Having feet like those of a goat.
clipping : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Clip | : (n.) The act of embracing. | : (n.) The act of cutting off, curtailing, or diminishing; the practice of clipping the edges of coins. | : (n.) That which is clipped off or out of something; a piece separated by clipping; as, newspaper clippings.
companied : (imp. & p. p.) of Company
camphretic : (a.) Pertaining to, or derived from camphor.
civily : (adv.) In a civil manner; as regards civil rights and privileges; politely; courteously; in a well bred manner.
clinometric : (a.) Pertaining to, or ascertained by, the clinometer. | : (a.) Pertaining to the oblique crystalline forms, or to solids which have oblique angles between the axes; as, the clinometric systems.
circumambient : (a.) Surrounding; inclosing or being on all sides; encompassing.
couch : (v. t.) To lay upon a bed or other resting place. | : (v. t.) To arrange or dispose as in a bed; -- sometimes followed by the reflexive pronoun. | : (v. t.) To lay or deposit in a bed or layer; to bed. | : (v. t.) To transfer (as sheets of partly dried pulp) from the wire cloth mold to a felt blanket, for further drying. | : (v. t.) To conceal; to include or involve darkly. | : (v. t.) To arrange; to place; to inlay. | : (v. t.) To put into some form of language; to express; to phrase; -- used with in and under. | : (v. t.) To treat by pushing down or displacing the opaque lens with a needle; as, to couch a cataract. | : (v. i.) To lie down or recline, as on a bed or other place of rest; to repose; to lie. | : (v. i.) To lie down for concealment; to hide; to be concealed; to be included or involved darkly. | : (v. i.) To bend the body, as in reverence, pain, labor, etc.; to stoop; to crouch. | : (v. t.) A mass of steeped barley spread upon a floor to germinate, in malting; or the floor occupied by the barley; as, couch of malt. | : (v. t.) A preliminary layer, as of color, size, etc.
convocating : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Convocate
conservator : (n.) One who preserves from injury or violation; a protector; a preserver. | : (n.) An officer who has charge of preserving the public peace, as a justice or sheriff. | : (n.) One who has an official charge of preserving the rights and privileges of a city, corporation, community, or estate.
crapule : (n.) Same as Crapulence.
commodore : (n.) An officer who ranks next above a captain; sometimes, by courtesy, the senior captain of a squadron. The rank of commodore corresponds with that of brigadier general in the army. | : (n.) A captain commanding a squadron, or a division of a fleet, or having the temporary rank of rear admiral. | : (n.) A title given by courtesy to the senior captain of a line of merchant vessels, and also to the chief officer of a yachting or rowing club. | : (n.) A familiar for the flagship, or for the principal vessel of a squadron or fleet.
cedilla : (n.) A mark placed under the letter c [thus, c], to show that it is to be sounded like s, as in facade.
capful : (n.) As much as will fill a cap.
cockfighting : (n.) The act or practice of pitting gamecocks to fight. | : (a.) Addicted to cockfighting.
colocynthin : (n.) The active medicinal principle of colocynth; a bitter, yellow, crystalline substance, regarded as a glucoside.
crapula : (n.) Alt. of Crapule
crystallogenical : (a.) Pertaining to the production of crystals; crystal-producing; as, crystallogenic attraction.
companies : (pl. ) of Company
connexive : (a.) See Connective.
circumflexion : (n.) The act of bending, or causing to assume a curved form. | : (n.) A winding about; a turning; a circuity; a fold.
counterpane : (n.) A coverlet for a bed, -- originally stitched or woven in squares or figures. | : (n.) A duplicate part or copy of an indenture, deed, etc., corresponding with the original; -- now called counterpart.
cradling : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Cradle | : (n.) The act of using a cradle. | : (n.) Cutting a cask into two pieces lengthwise, to enable it to pass a narrow place, the two parts being afterward united and rehooped. | : (n.) The framework in arched or coved ceilings to which the laths are nailed.
conclusive : (a.) Belonging to a close or termination; decisive; convincing; putting an end to debate or question; leading to, or involving, a conclusion or decision.
commonition : (n.) Advice; warning; instruction.
convocation : (n.) The act of calling or assembling by summons. | : (n.) An assembly or meeting. | : (n.) An assembly of the clergy, by their representatives, to consult on ecclesiastical affairs. | : (n.) An academical assembly, in which the business of the university is transacted.
coadjutive : (a.) Rendering mutual aid; coadjutant.
chassepot : (n.) A kind of breechloading, center-fire rifle, or improved needle gun.
cuinage : (n.) The stamping of pigs of tin, by the proper officer, with the arms of the duchy of Cornwall.
cosureties : (pl. ) of Cosurety
cuckoobud : (n.) A species of Ranunculus (R. bulbosus); -- called also butterflower, buttercup, kingcup, goldcup.
calaboose : (n.) A prison; a jail.
choragi : (pl. ) of Choragus
countries : (pl. ) of Country
choctaws : (n. pl.) A tribe of North American Indians (Southern Appalachian), in early times noted for their pursuit of agriculture, and for living at peace with the white settlers. They are now one of the civilized tribes of the Indian Territory.
cherogril : (n.) See Cony.
cero : (n.) A large and valuable fish of the Mackerel family, of the genus Scomberomorus. Two species are found in the West Indies and less commonly on the Atlantic coast of the United States, -- the common cero (Scomberomorus caballa), called also kingfish, and spotted, or king, cero (S. regalis).
centumviri : (pl. ) of Centumvir
confutement : (n.) Confutation.
cantion : (n.) A song or verses.
catoptrical : (a.) Of or pertaining to catoptrics; produced by reflection.
conoid : (n.) Anything that has a form resembling that of a cone. | : (n.) A solid formed by the revolution of a conic section about its axis; as, a parabolic conoid, elliptic conoid, etc.; -- more commonly called paraboloid, ellipsoid, etc. | : (n.) A surface which may be generated by a straight line moving in such a manner as always to meet a given straight line and a given curve, and continue parallel to a given plane. | : (a.) Resembling a cone; conoidal.
commigration : (n.) Migration together.
calkin : (n.) A calk on a shoe. See Calk, n., 1.
cere : (n.) The soft naked sheath at the base of the beak of birds of prey, parrots, and some other birds. See Beak. | : (v. t.) To wax; to cover or close with wax.
circumcise : (v. t.) To cut off the prepuce of foreskin of, in the case of males, and the internal labia of, in the case of females. | : (v. t.) To purify spiritually.
cibol : (n.) A perennial alliaceous plant (Allium fistulosum), sometimes called Welsh onion. Its fistular leaves areused in cookery.
chlormethane : (n.) A colorless gas, CH3Cl, of a sweet odor, easily condensed to a liquid; -- called also methyl chloride.
continent : (a.) Serving to restrain or limit; restraining; opposing. | : (a.) Exercising restraint as to the indulgence of desires or passions; temperate; moderate. | : (a.) Abstaining from sexual intercourse; exercising restraint upon the sexual appetite; esp., abstaining from illicit sexual intercourse; chaste. | : (a.) Not interrupted; connected; continuous; as, a continent fever. | : (a.) That which contains anything; a receptacle. | : (a.) One of the grand divisions of land on the globe; the main land; specifically (Phys. Geog.), a large body of land differing from an island, not merely in its size, but in its structure, which is that of a large basin bordered by mountain chains; as, the continent of North America.
conversazi-one : (n.) A meeting or assembly for conversation, particularly on literary or scientific subjects.
classis : (n.) A class or order; sort; kind. | : (n.) An ecclesiastical body or judicatory in certain churches, as the Reformed Dutch. It is intermediate between the consistory and the synod, and corresponds to the presbytery in the Presbyterian church.
cumbrian : (a.) Pertaining to Cumberland, England, or to a system of rocks found there.
contesting : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Contest
countrify : (v. t.) To give a rural appearance to; to cause to appear rustic.
condylomata : (pl. ) of Condylome
couchant : (v. t.) Lying down with head erect; squatting. | : (v. t.) Lying down with the head raised, which distinguishes the posture of couchant from that of dormant, or sleeping; -- said of a lion or other beast.
coronate : (a.) Alt. of Coronated
cerumen : (n.) The yellow, waxlike secretion from the glands of the external ear; the earwax.
centred : ( ) of Centre
corsepresent : (n.) An offering made to the church at the interment of a dead body.
caledonian : (a.) Of or pertaining to Caledonia or Scotland; Scottish; Scotch. | : (n.) A native or inhabitant of Caledonia or Scotland.
cardamine : (n.) A genus of cruciferous plants, containing the lady's-smock, cuckooflower, bitter cress, meadow cress, etc.
cocleariform : (a.) Spoon-shaped.
cemetery : (n.) A place or ground set apart for the burial of the dead; a graveyard; a churchyard; a necropolis.
cecity : (n.) Blindness.
cropping : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Crop
chay root : ( ) The root of the Oldenlandia umbellata, native in India, which yieds a durable red dyestuff.
calycle : (n.) A row of small bracts, at the base of the calyx, on the outside.
cleavers : (n.) A species of Galium (G. Aparine), having a fruit set with hooked bristles, which adhere to whatever they come in contact with; -- called also, goose grass, catchweed, etc.
colies : (pl. ) of Coly
cess : (n.) A rate or tax. | : (n.) Bound; measure. | : (v. t.) To rate; to tax; to assess. | : (v. i.) To cease; to neglect.
canting : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Cant | : (a.) Speaking in a whining tone of voice; using technical or religious terms affectedly; affectedly pious; as, a canting rogue; a canting tone. | : (n.) The use of cant; hypocrisy.
cest : (n.) A woman's girdle; a cestus.
contradistinguishing : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Contradistinguish
cantine : (n.) See Canteen.
consensus : (n.) Agreement; accord; consent.
conticent : (a.) Silent.
classic : (n.) Alt. of Classical | : (n.) A work of acknowledged excellence and authority, or its author; -- originally used of Greek and Latin works or authors, but now applied to authors and works of a like character in any language. | : (n.) One learned in the literature of Greece and Rome, or a student of classical literature.
clubfooted : (a.) Having a clubfoot.
comprovincial : (a.) Belonging to, or associated in, the same province. | : (n.) One who belongs to the same province.
cometographer : (n.) One who describes or writes about comets.
cete : (n.) One of the Cetacea, or collectively, the Cetacea.
countenance : (v. t.) To encourage; to favor; to approve; to aid; to abet. | : (v. t.) To make a show of; to pretend.
chalkcutter : (n.) A man who digs chalk.
christcross : (n.) The mark of the cross, as cut, painted, written, or stamped on certain objects, -- sometimes as the sign of 12 o'clock on a dial. | : (n.) The beginning and the ending.
counterirritation : (n.) See Counter irritant, etc., under Counter, a.
curvative : (a.) Having the margins only a little curved; -- said of leaves.
calceolaria : (n.) A genus of showy herbaceous or shrubby plants, brought from South America; slipperwort. It has a yellow or purple flower, often spotted or striped, the shape of which suggests its name.
clare-obscure : (n.) See Chiaroscuro.
collish : (n.) A tool to polish the edge of a sole.
calcedonic : (a.) Alt. of Calcedonian
colloquial : (a.) Pertaining to, or used in, conversation, esp. common and familiar conversation; conversational; hence, unstudied; informal; as, colloquial intercourse; colloquial phrases; a colloquial style.
countersigning : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Countersign
categorist : (n.) One who inserts in a category or list; one who classifies.
cohabiter : (n.) A cohabitant.
cloths : (pl. ) of Cloth
cornopean : (n.) An obsolete name for the cornet-a-piston.
cocoon : (n.) An oblong case in which the silkworm lies in its chrysalis state. It is formed of threads of silk spun by the worm just before leaving the larval state. From these the silk of commerce is prepared. | : (n.) The case constructed by any insect to contain its larva or pupa. | : (n.) The case of silk made by spiders to protect their eggs. | : (n.) The egg cases of mucus, etc., made by leeches and other worms.
clemency : (n.) Disposition to forgive and spare, as offenders; mildness of temper; gentleness; tenderness; mercy. | : (n.) Mildness or softness of the elements; as, the clemency of the season.
cercaria : (n.) The larval form of a trematode worm having the shape of a tadpole, with its body terminated by a tail-like appendage.
charte : (n.) The constitution, or fundamental law, of the French monarchy, as established on the restoration of Louis XVIII., in 1814.
cowlike : (a.) Resembling a cow.
contaminating : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Contaminate
cephalology : (n.) The science which treats of the head.
charta : (n.) Material on which instruments, books, etc., are written; parchment or paper. | : (n.) A charter or deed; a writing by which a grant is made. See Magna Charta.
chameck : (n.) A kind of spider monkey (Ateles chameck), having the thumbs rudimentary and without a nail.
carotin : (n.) A red crystallizable tasteless substance, extracted from the carrot.
counterpart : (n.) A part corresponding to another part; anything which answers, or corresponds, to another; a copy; a duplicate; a facsimile. | : (n.) One of two corresponding copies of an instrument; a duplicate. | : (n.) A person who closely resembles another. | : (n.) A thing may be applied to another thing so as to fit perfectly, as a seal to its impression; hence, a thing which is adapted to another thing, or which supplements it; that which serves to complete or complement anything; hence, a person or thing having qualities lacking in another; an opposite.
captiously : (adv.) In a captious manner.
cohabited : (imp. & p. p.) of Cohabit
carotic : (a.) Of or pertaining to stupor; as, a carotic state. | : (a.) Carotid; as, the carotic arteries.
crengle : (n.) Alt. of Crenkle
cagmag : (n.) A tough old goose; hence, coarse, bad food of any kind.
carotid : (n.) One of the two main arteries of the neck, by which blood is conveyed from the aorta to the head. [See Illust. of Aorta.] | : (a.) Alt. of Carotidal
clothe : (v. t.) To put garments on; to cover with clothing; to dress. | : (v. t.) To provide with clothes; as, to feed and clothe a family; to clothe one's self extravagantly. | : (v. t.) Fig.: To cover or invest, as with a garment; as, to clothe one with authority or power. | : (v. i.) To wear clothes.
colorado group : ( ) A subdivision of the cretaceous formation of western North America, especially developed in Colorado and the upper Missouri region.
chaparral : (n.) A thicket of low evergreen oaks. | : (n.) An almost impenetrable thicket or succession of thickets of thorny shrubs and brambles.
clemence : (n.) Clemency.
coronary : (a.) Of or pertaining to a crown; forming, or adapted to form, a crown or garland. | : (a.) Resembling, or situated like, a crown or circlet; as, the coronary arteries and veins of the heart. | : (n.) A small bone in the foot of a horse. | : (n.) Informal shortening of coronary thrombosis, also used generally to mean heart attack.
commercialism : (n.) The commercial spirit or method.
chiastolite : (n.) A variety of andalusite; -- called also macle. The tessellated appearance of a cross section is due to the symmetrical arrangement of impurities in the crystal.
cup-moss : (n.) A kind of lichen, of the genus Cladonia.
cullionly : (a.) Mean; base.
cabinetmaker : (n.) One whose occupation is to make cabinets or other choice articles of household furniture, as tables, bedsteads, bureaus, etc.
caroche : (n.) A kind of pleasure carriage; a coach.
coffeeman : (n.) One who keeps a coffeehouse.
cantile : (v. i.) Same as Cantle, v. t.

chartreux : (n.) A Carthusian.
clothing : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Clothe | : (n.) Garments in general; clothes; dress; raiment; covering. | : (n.) The art of process of making cloth. | : (n.) A covering of non-conducting material on the outside of a boiler, or steam chamber, to prevent radiation of heat. | : (n.) See Card clothing, under 3d Card.
congeable : (a.) Permissible; done lawfully; as, entry congeable.
calyces : (pl. ) of Calyx
creatinin : (n.) A white, crystalline, nitrogenous body closely related to creatin but more basic in its properties, formed from the latter by the action of acids, and occurring naturally in muscle tissue and in urine.

coleopteral : (a.) Alt. of Coleopterous

coleopteran : (n.) One of the order of Coleoptera.
conclusion : (n.) The last part of anything; close; termination; end. | : (n.) Final decision; determination; result. | : (n.) Any inference or result of reasoning. | : (n.) The inferred proposition of a syllogism; the necessary consequence of the conditions asserted in two related propositions called premises. See Syllogism. | : (n.) Drawing of inferences. | : (n.) An experiment, or something from which a conclusion may be drawn. | : (n.) The end or close of a pleading, e.g., the formal ending of an indictment, "against the peace," etc. | : (n.) An estoppel or bar by which a person is held to a particular position.
contrition : (n.) The act of grinding or ribbing to powder; attrition; friction; rubbing. | : (n.) The state of being contrite; deep sorrow and repentance for sin, because sin is displeasing to God; humble penitence; through repentance.

coadjuting : (a.) Mutually assisting.
cartilagineous : (a.) See Cartilaginous.
circumvection : (n.) The act of carrying anything around, or the state of being so carried.
condensation : (n.) The act or process of condensing or of being condensed; the state of being condensed. | : (n.) The act or process of reducing, by depression of temperature or increase of pressure, etc., to another and denser form, as gas to the condition of a liquid or steam to water. | : (n.) A rearrangement or concentration of the different constituents of one or more substances into a distinct and definite compound of greater complexity and molecular weight, often resulting in an increase of density, as the condensation of oxygen into ozone, or of acetone into mesitylene.

clotted : (imp. & p. p.) of Clot | : (a.) Composed of clots or clods; having the quality or form of a clot; sticky; slimy; foul.
cementation : (n.) The act or process of cementing. | : (n.) A process which consists in surrounding a solid body with the powder of other substances, and heating the whole to a degree not sufficient to cause fusion, the physical properties of the body being changed by chemical combination with powder; thus iron becomes steel by cementation with charcoal, and green glass becomes porcelain by cementation with sand.
congresses : (pl. ) of Congress
coucal : (n.) A large, Old World, ground cuckoo of the genus Centropus, of several species.
calando : (a.) Gradually diminishing in rapidity and loudness.
chronogrammatic : (a.) Alt. of Chronogrammatical
crucible : (n.) A vessel or melting pot, composed of some very refractory substance, as clay, graphite, platinum, and used for melting and calcining substances which require a strong degree of heat, as metals, ores, etc. | : (n.) A hollow place at the bottom of a furnace, to receive the melted metal. | : (n.) A test of the most decisive kind; a severe trial; as, the crucible of affliction.
capitellate : (a.) Having a very small knoblike termination, or collected into minute capitula.

corfute : (n.) A native or inhabitant of Corfu, an island in the Mediterranean Sea.

czechic : (a.) Of or pertaining to the Czechs.
cubiform : (a.) Of the form of a cube.
contrecoup : (n.) A concussion or shock produced by a blow or other injury, in a part or region opposite to that at which the blow is received, often causing rupture or disorganisation of the parts affected.
cacuminal : (a.) Pertaining to the top of the palate; cerebral; -- applied to certain consonants; as, cacuminal (or cerebral) letters.
chlorophane : (n.) A variety of fluor spar, which, when heated, gives a beautiful emerald green light. | : (n.) The yellowish green pigment in the inner segment of the cones of the retina. See Chromophane.
censured : (imp. & p. p.) of Censure
classmate : (n.) One who is in the same class with another, as at school or college.
chiliarchy : (n.) A body consisting of a thousand men.
concaved : (imp. & p. p.) of Concave | : (a.) Bowed in the form of an arch; -- called also arched.
concavo-convex : (a.) Concave on one side and convex on the other, as an eggshell or a crescent. | : (a.) Specifically, having such a combination of concave and convex sides as makes the focal axis the shortest line between them. See Illust. under Lens.
confirming : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Confirm
coenurus : (n.) The larval stage of a tapeworm (Taenia coenurus) which forms bladderlike sacs in the brain of sheep, causing the fatal disease known as water brain, vertigo, staggers or gid.
coastwise : (adv.) Alt. of Coastways
cycloganoidei : (n. pl.) An order of ganoid fishes, having cycloid scales. The bowfin (Amia calva) is a living example.
classific : (a.) Characterizing a class or classes; relating to classification.
crural : (a.) Of or pertaining to the thigh or leg, or to any of the parts called crura; as, the crural arteries; crural arch; crural canal; crural ring.
censurer : (n.) One who censures.
chromite : (n.) A black submetallic mineral consisting of oxide of chromium and iron; -- called also chromic iron. | : (n.) A compound or salt of chromous hydroxide regarded as an acid.

cnidoblast : (n.) One of the cells which, in the Coelenterata, develop into cnidae.
comfortable : (a.) Strong; vigorous; valiant. | : (a.) Serviceable; helpful. | : (a.) Affording or imparting comfort or consolation; able to comfort; cheering; as, a comfortable hope. | : (a.) In a condition of comfort; having comforts; not suffering or anxious; hence, contented; cheerful; as, to lead a comfortable life. | : (a.) Free, or comparatively free, from pain or distress; -- used of a sick person. | : (n.) A stuffed or quilted coverlet for a bed; a comforter; a comfort.

completely : (adv.) In a complete manner; fully.
comfortment : (n.) Act or process of administering comfort.
chocolate : (n.) A paste or cake composed of the roasted seeds of the Theobroma Cacao ground and mixed with other ingredients, usually sugar, and cinnamon or vanilla. | : (n.) The beverage made by dissolving a portion of the paste or cake in boiling water or milk.

catenating : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Catenate
catechiser : (n.) One who catechises.
courtehouse : (n.) A house in which established courts are held, or a house appropriated to courts and public meetings. | : (n.) A county town; -- so called in Virginia and some others of the Southern States.

conquering : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Conquer
calefactive : (a.) See Calefactory.
cairngormstone : ( ) A yellow or smoky brown variety of rock crystal, or crystallized quartz, found esp, in the mountain of Cairngorm, in Scotland.
canderos : (n.) An East Indian resin, of a pellucid white color, from which small ornaments and toys are sometimes made.
capybara : (n.) A large South American rodent (Hydrochaerus capybara) Living on the margins of lakes and rivers. It is the largest extant rodent, being about three feet long, and half that in height. It somewhat resembles the Guinea pig, to which it is related; -- called also cabiai and water hog.
counter brace : ( ) The brace of the fore-topsail on the leeward side of a vessel. | : ( ) A brace, in a framed structure, which resists a strain of a character opposite to that which a main brace is designed to receive.
comfiture : (n.) See Comfit, n.
categories : (pl. ) of Category
calculous : (a.) Of the nature of a calculus; like stone; gritty; as, a calculous concretion. | : (a.) Caused, or characterized, by the presence of a calculus or calculi; a, a calculous disorder; affected with gravel or stone; as, a calculous person.
concavity : (n.) A concave surface, or the space bounded by it; the state of being concave.
civism : (n.) State of citizenship.
cavalierly : (adv.) In a supercilious, disdainful, or haughty manner; arrogantly.
capitula : (n. pl.) See Capitulum.
cervix : (n.) The neck; also, the necklike portion of any part, as of the womb. See Illust. of Bird.
cirsocele : (n.) The varicose dilatation of the spermatic vein.
castlet : (n.) A small castle.
corroborative : (a.) Tending to strengthen of confirm. | : (n.) A medicine that strengthens; a corroborant.
climate : (v. i.) One of thirty regions or zones, parallel to the equator, into which the surface of the earth from the equator to the pole was divided, according to the successive increase of the length of the midsummer day. | : (v. i.) The condition of a place in relation to various phenomena of the atmosphere, as temperature, moisture, etc., especially as they affect animal or vegetable life. | : (v. i.) To dwell.
cosmos : (n.) The universe or universality of created things; -- so called from the order and harmony displayed in it. | : (n.) The theory or description of the universe, as a system displaying order and harmony.
calenture : (n.) A name formerly given to various fevers occuring in tropics; esp. to a form of furious delirium accompanied by fever, among sailors, which sometimes led the affected person to imagine the sea to be a green field, and to throw himself into it. | : (v. i.) To see as in the delirium of one affected with calenture.
chinquapin : (n.) A branching, nut-bearing tree or shrub (Castanea pumila) of North America, from six to twenty feet high, allied to the chestnut. Also, its small, sweet, edible nat.
continuously : (adv.) In a continuous maner; without interruption.
cousin-german : (n.) A first cousin. See Note under Cousin, 1.
celidography : (n.) A description of apparent spots on the disk of the sun, or on planets.
cornfield : (n.) A field where corn is or has been growing; -- in England, a field of wheat, rye, barley, or oats; in America, a field of Indian corn.

curvation : (n.) The act of bending or crooking.
choker : (n.) One who, or that which, chokes. | : (n.) A stiff wide cravat; a stock.
cereal : (a.) Of or pertaining to the grasses which are cultivated for their edible seeds (as wheat, maize, rice, etc.), or to their seeds or grain. | : (n.) Any grass cultivated for its edible grain, or the grain itself; -- usually in the plural.
carpology : (n.) That branch of botany which relates to the structure of seeds and fruit.
climatology : (n.) The science which treats of climates and investigates their phenomena and causes.
chylifaction : (n.) The act or process by which chyle is formed from food in animal bodies; chylification, -- a digestive process.
