citicism : (n.) The manners of a cit or citizen.
crinicultural : (a.) Relating to the growth of hair.
cacajao : (n.) A South American short-tailed monkey (Pithecia (/ Brachyurus) melanocephala).
construprated : (imp. & p. p.) of Constuprate
censor : (n.) One of two magistrates of Rome who took a register of the number and property of citizens, and who also exercised the office of inspector of morals and conduct. | : (n.) One who is empowered to examine manuscripts before they are committed to the press, and to forbid their publication if they contain anything obnoxious; -- an official in some European countries. | : (n.) One given to fault-finding; a censurer. | : (n.) A critic; a reviewer.
cutting : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Cut | : (n.) The act or process of making an incision, or of severing, felling, shaping, etc. | : (n.) Something cut, cut off, or cut out, as a twig or scion cut off from a stock for the purpose of grafting or of rooting as an independent plant; something cut out of a newspaper; an excavation cut through a hill or elsewhere to make a way for a railroad, canal, etc.; a cut. | : (a.) Adapted to cut; as, a cutting tool. | : (a.) Chilling; penetrating; sharp; as, a cutting wind. | : (a.) Severe; sarcastic; biting; as, a cutting reply.
cystidea : (n. pl.) An order of Crinoidea, mostly fossils of the Paleozoic rocks. They were usually roundish or egg-shaped, and often unsymmetrical; some were sessile, others had short stems.
comprehensiveness : (n.) The quality of being comprehensive; extensiveness of scope.
cubited : (a.) Having the measure of a cubit.
cystoidea : (n.) Same as Cystidea.
consideringly : (adv.) With consideration or deliberation.
cyrenaic : (a.) Pertaining to Cyrenaica, an ancient country of northern Africa, and to Cyrene, its principal city; also, to a school of philosophy founded by Aristippus, a native of Cyrene. | : (n.) A native of Cyrenaica; also, a disciple of the school of Aristippus. See Cyrenian, n.
compunction : (n.) A pricking; stimulation. | : (n.) A picking of heart; poignant grief proceeding from a sense of guilt or consciousness of causing pain; the sting of conscience.
craft : (n.) Strength; might; secret power. | : (n.) Art or skill; dexterity in particular manual employment; hence, the occupation or employment itself; manual art; a trade. | : (n.) Those engaged in any trade, taken collectively; a guild; as, the craft of ironmongers. | : (n.) Cunning, art, or skill, in a bad sense, or applied to bad purposes; artifice; guile; skill or dexterity employed to effect purposes by deceit or shrewd devices. | : (n.) A vessel; vessels of any kind; -- generally used in a collective sense. | : (v. t.) To play tricks; to practice artifice.
crosspatch : (n.) An ill-natured person.
calamistrum : (n.) A comblike structure on the metatarsus of the hind legs of certain spiders (Ciniflonidae), used to curl certain fibers in the construction of their webs.
comitial : (a.) Relating to the comitia, or popular assemblies of the Romans for electing officers and passing laws.
chesterlite : (n.) A variety of feldspar found in crystals in the county of Chester, Pennsylvania.
churlishness : (n.) Rudeness of manners or temper; lack of kindness or courtesy.
cleping : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Clepe
coarse : (superl.) Large in bulk, or composed of large parts or particles; of inferior quality or appearance; not fine in material or close in texture; gross; thick; rough; -- opposed to fine; as, coarse sand; coarse thread; coarse cloth; coarse bread. | : (superl.) Not refined; rough; rude; unpolished; gross; indelicate; as, coarse manners; coarse language.
commination : (n.) A threat or threatening; a denunciation of punishment or vengeance. | : (n.) An office in the liturgy of the Church of England, used on Ash Wednesday, containing a recital of God's anger and judgments against sinners.
clair-obscur : (n.) See Chiaroscuro.
caliginous : (a.) Affected with darkness or dimness; dark; obscure.
cortes : (n. pl.) The legislative assembly, composed of nobility, clergy, and representatives of cities, which in Spain and in Portugal answers, in some measure, to the Parliament of Great Britain.
challengeable : (a.) That may be challenged.
cortex : (n.) Bark, as of a tree; hence, an outer covering. | : (n.) Bark; rind; specifically, cinchona bark. | : (n.) The outer or superficial part of an organ; as, the cortex or gray exterior substance of the brain.
captiousness : (n.) Captious disposition or manner.
cascade : (n.) A fall of water over a precipice, as in a river or brook; a waterfall less than a cataract. | : (v. i.) To fall in a cascade. | : (v. i.) To vomit.
cleaner : (n.) One who, or that which, cleans.
capture : (n.) The act of seizing by force, or getting possession of by superior power or by stratagem; as, the capture of an enemy, a vessel, or a criminal. | : (n.) The securing of an object of strife or desire, as by the power of some attraction. | : (n.) The thing taken by force, surprise, or stratagem; a prize; prey. | : (v. t.) To seize or take possession of by force, surprise, or stratagem; to overcome and hold; to secure by effort.
cochleated : (a.) Having the form of a snail shell; spiral; turbinated.
coward : (a.) Borne in the escutcheon with his tail doubled between his legs; -- said of a lion. | : (a.) Destitute of courage; timid; cowardly. | : (a.) Belonging to a coward; proceeding from, or expressive of, base fear or timidity. | : (n.) A person who lacks courage; a timid or pusillanimous person; a poltroon. | : (v. t.) To make timorous; to frighten.
chancing : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Chance
commutator : (n.) A piece of apparatus used for reversing the direction of an electrical current; an attachment to certain electrical machines, by means of which alternating currents are made to be continuous or to have the same direction.
complexionally : (adv.) Constitutionally.
chinsed : (imp. & p. p.) of Chinse
coeternal : (a.) Equally eternal.
cambistry : (n.) The science of exchange, weight, measures, etc.
countrywomen : (pl. ) of Countrywoman
calvary : (n.) The place where Christ was crucified, on a small hill outside of Jerusalem. | : (n.) A representation of the crucifixion, consisting of three crosses with the figures of Christ and the thieves, often as large as life, and sometimes surrounded by figures of other personages who were present at the crucifixion. | : (n.) A cross, set upon three steps; -- more properly called cross calvary.
companable : (a.) Companionable; sociable.
cleaned : (imp. & p. p.) of Clean
crystallizable : (a.) Capable of being crystallized; that may be formed into crystals.
carthusian : (n.) A member of an exceeding austere religious order, founded at Chartreuse in France by St. Bruno, in the year 1086. | : (a.) Pertaining to the Carthusian.
cyclometry : (n.) The art of measuring circles.
clunch : (n.) Indurated clay. See Bind, n., 3. | : (n.) One of the hard beds of the lower chalk.
contradistinct : (a.) Distinguished by opposite qualities.
centiare : (n.) See centare.
chalcanthite : (n.) Native blue vitriol. See Blue vitriol, under Blue.
catered : (imp. & p. p.) of Cater
candle coal : ( ) See Cannel coal.
cannons : (pl. ) of Cannon
craie : (n.) See Crare.
cavatina : (n.) Originally, a melody of simpler form than the aria; a song without a second part and a da capo; -- a term now variously and vaguely used.
chunk : (n.) A short, thick piece of anything.
castanets : (n. pl.) Two small, concave shells of ivory or hard wood, shaped like spoons, fastened to the thumb, and beaten together with the middle finger; -- used by the Spaniards and Moors as an accompaniment to their dance and guitars.
cecidomyia : (n.) A genus of small dipterous files, including several very injurious species, as the Hessian fly. See Hessian fly.
committable : (a.) Capable of being committed.
charles's wain : ( ) The group of seven stars, commonly called the Dipper, in the constellation Ursa Major, or Great Bear. See Ursa major, under Ursa.
cyanotic : (a.) Relating to cyanosis; affected with cyanosis; as, a cyanotic patient; having the hue caused by cyanosis; as, a cyanotic skin.
cacuminate : (v. i.) To make sharp or pointed.
colligation : (n.) A binding together. | : (n.) That process by which a number of isolated facts are brought under one conception, or summed up in a general proposition, as when Kepler discovered that the various observed positions of the planet Mars were points in an ellipse.
commonplace : (a.) Common; ordinary; trite; as, a commonplace person, or observation. | : (n.) An idea or expression wanting originality or interest; a trite or customary remark; a platitude. | : (n.) A memorandum; something to be frequently consulted or referred to. | : (v. t.) To enter in a commonplace book, or to reduce to general heads. | : (v. i.) To utter commonplaces; to indulge in platitudes.
captivate : (v. t.) To take prisoner; to capture; to subdue. | : (v. t.) To acquire ascendancy over by reason of some art or attraction; to fascinate; to charm; as, Cleopatra captivated Antony; the orator captivated all hearts. | : (p. a.) Taken prisoner; made captive; insnared; charmed.
caterer : (n.) One who caters.
catamenia : (n. pl.) The monthly courses of women; menstrual discharges; menses.
chrysaniline : (n.) A yellow substance obtained as a by-product in the manufacture of rosaniline. It dyes silk a fine golden-yellow color.
crystallography : (n.) The doctrine or science of crystallization, teaching the system of forms among crystals, their structure, and their methods of formation. | : (n.) A discourse or treatise on crystallization.
chignon : (n.) A knot, boss, or mass of hair, natural or artificial, worn by a woman at the back of the head.
conjugial : (a.) Conjugal.
clumber : (n.) A kind of field spaniel, with short legs and stout body, which, unlike other spaniels, hunts silently.
crudities : (pl. ) of Crudity
curbless : (a.) Having no curb or restraint.
catalepsis : (n.) A sudden suspension of sensation and volition, the body and limbs preserving the position that may be given them, while the action of the heart and lungs continues.
celtiberian : (a.) Of or pertaining to the ancient Celtiberia (a district in Spain lying between the Ebro and the Tagus) or its inhabitants the Celtiberi (Celts of the river Iberus). | : (n.) An inhabitant of Celtiberia.
cartilaginous : (a.) Of or pertaining to cartilage; gristly; firm and tough like cartilage. | : (a.) Having the skeleton in the state of cartilage, the bones containing little or no calcareous matter; said of certain fishes, as the sturgeon and the sharks.
conscient : (a.) Conscious.
crail : (n.) A creel or osier basket.
colligating : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Colligate
contemningly : (adv.) Contemptuously.
criminology : (n.) A treatise on crime or the criminal population.
cast-off : (a.) Cast or laid aside; as, cast-off clothes.
clubber : (n.) One who clubs. | : (n.) A member of a club.
chisel : (n.) A tool with a cutting edge on one end of a metal blade, used in dressing, shaping, or working in timber, stone, metal, etc.; -- usually driven by a mallet or hammer. | : (v. t.) To cut, pare, gouge, or engrave with a chisel; as, to chisel a block of marble into a statue. | : (v. t.) To cut close, as in a bargain; to cheat.
controversy : (n.) Contention; dispute; debate; discussion; agitation of contrary opinions. | : (n.) Quarrel; strife; cause of variance; difference. | : (n.) A suit in law or equity; a question of right.
command : (v. t.) To order with authority; to lay injunction upon; to direct; to bid; to charge. | : (v. t.) To exercise direct authority over; to have control of; to have at one's disposal; to lead. | : (v. t.) To have within a sphere of control, influence, access, or vision; to dominate by position; to guard; to overlook. | : (v. t.) To have power or influence of the nature of authority over; to obtain as if by ordering; to receive as a due; to challenge; to claim; as, justice commands the respect and affections of the people; the best goods command the best price. | : (v. t.) To direct to come; to bestow. | : (v. i.) To have or to exercise direct authority; to govern; to sway; to influence; to give an order or orders. | : (v. i.) To have a view, as from a superior position. | : (n.) An authoritative order requiring obedience; a mandate; an injunction. | : (n.) The possession or exercise of authority. | : (n.) Authority; power or right of control; leadership; as, the forces under his command. | : (n.) Power to dominate, command, or overlook by means of position; scope of vision; survey. | : (n.) Control; power over something; sway; influence; as, to have command over one's temper or voice; the fort has command of the bridge. | : (n.) A body of troops, or any naval or military force or post, or the whole territory under the authority or control of a particular officer.
controverse : (n.) Controversy. | : (v. t.) To dispute; to controvert.
carbamine : (n.) An isocyanide of a hydrocarbon radical. The carbamines are liquids, usually colorless, and of unendurable odor.
carotidal : (a.) Pertaining to, or near, the carotids or one of them; as, the carotid gland.
compulsory : (a.) Having the power of compulsion; constraining. | : (a.) Obligatory; enjoined by authority; necessary; due to compulsion.
cablelaid : (a.) Composed of three three-stranded ropes, or hawsers, twisted together to form a cable. | : (a.) Twisted after the manner of a cable; as, a cable-laid gold chain.
centrobaric : (a.) Relating to the center of gravity, or to the process of finding it.
chump : (n.) A short, thick, heavy piece of wood.
clubbed : (imp. & p. p.) of Club | : (a.) Shaped like a club; grasped like, or used as, a club.
clubhouse : (n.) A house occupied by a club.
clacking : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Clack
cissoid : (n.) A curve invented by Diocles, for the purpose of solving two celebrated problems of the higher geometry; viz., to trisect a plane angle, and to construct two geometrical means between two given straight lines.
cottise : (n.) A diminutive of the bendlet, containing one half its area or one quarter the area of the bend. When a single cottise is used alone it is often called a cost. See also Couple-close.
cicatrose : (a.) Full of scars.
cruiser : (n.) One who, or a vessel that, cruises; -- usually an armed vessel.
collator : (n.) One who collates manuscripts, books, etc. | : (n.) One who collates to a benefice. | : (n.) One who confers any benefit.
compinge : (v. t.) To compress; to shut up.
contline : (n.) The space between the strands on the outside of a rope. | : (n.) The space between the bilges of two casks stowed side by side.
charmless : (a.) Destitute of charms.
charlock : (n.) A cruciferous plant (Brassica sinapistrum) with yellow flowers; wild mustard. It is troublesome in grain fields. Called also chardock, chardlock, chedlock, and kedlock.
catmint : (n.) A well-know plant of the genus Nepeta (N. Cataria), somewhat like mint, having a string scent, and sometimes used in medicine. It is so called because cats have a peculiar fondness for it.
caviare : (n.) Alt. of Caviar
conspissation : (n.) A making thick or viscous; thickness; inspissation.
cruised : (imp. & p. p.) of Cruise
chewer : (n.) One who chews.
cat-salt : (n.) A sort of salt, finely granulated, formed out of the bittern or leach brine.
chewet : (n.) A kind of meat pie.
corncob : (n.) The cob or axis on which the kernels of Indian corn grow.
crankness : (n.) Liability to be overset; -- said of a ship or other vessel. | : (n.) Sprightliness; vigor; health.
chondrodite : (n.) A fluosilicate of magnesia and iron, yellow to red in color, often occurring in granular form in a crystalline limestone.
congratulator : (n.) One who offers congratulation.
cardines : (pl. ) of Cardo
centennially : (adv.) Once in a hundred years.
coalesce : (n.) To grow together; to unite by growth into one body; as, the parts separated by a wound coalesce. | : (n.) To unite in one body or product; to combine into one body or community; as, vapors coalesce.
condensated : (imp. & p. p.) of Condensate
centrical : (a.) Placed in the center or middle; central.
catechistic : (a.) Alt. of Catechistical
capitalize : (v. t.) To convert into capital, or to use as capital. | : (v. t.) To compute, appraise, or assess the capital value of (a patent right, an annuity, etc.) | : (v. t.) To print in capital letters, or with an initial capital.
charismatic : (a.) Of or pertaining to a charism.
crossly : (adv.) Athwart; adversely; unfortunately; peevishly; fretfully; with ill humor.
conception : (n.) The act of conceiving in the womb; the initiation of an embryonic animal life. | : (n.) The state of being conceived; beginning. | : (n.) The power or faculty of apprehending of forming an idea in the mind; the power of recalling a past sensation or perception. | : (n.) The formation in the mind of an image, idea, or notion, apprehension. | : (n.) The image, idea, or notion of any action or thing which is formed in the mind; a concept; a notion; a universal; the product of a rational belief or judgment. See Concept. | : (n.) Idea; purpose; design. | : (n.) Conceit; affected sentiment or thought.
contaminated : (imp. & p. p.) of Contaminate
contravene : (v. t.) To meet in the way of opposition; to come into conflict with; to oppose; to contradict; to obstruct the operation of; to defeat. | : (v. t.) To violate; to nullify; to be inconsistent with; as, to contravene a law.
curculionidous : (a.) Pertaining to the Curculionideae, or weevil tribe.
cringle : (n.) A withe for fastening a gate. | : (n.) An iron or pope thimble or grommet worked into or attached to the edges and corners of a sail; -- usually in the plural. The cringles are used for making fast the bowline bridles, earings, etc.
connotation : (n.) The act of connoting; a making known or designating something additional; implication of something more than is asserted.
crib-biting : (n.) Same as Cribbing, 4.
cerebroid : (a.) Resembling, or analogous to, the cerebrum or brain.
carphology : (n.) See Floccillation.
coprolite : (n.) A piece of petrified dung; a fossil excrement.
couching : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Couch | : (n.) The operation of putting down or displacing the opaque lens in cataract. | : (n.) Embroidering by laying the materials upon the surface of the foundation, instead of drawing them through.
caudling : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Caudle
certifier : (n.) One who certifies or assures.
carbonometer : (n.) An instrument for detecting and measuring the amount of carbon which is present, or more esp. the amount of carbon dioxide, by its action on limewater or by other means.
canaster : (n.) A kind of tobacco for smoking, made of the dried leaves, coarsely broken; -- so called from the rush baskets in which it is packed in South America.
childermas day : ( ) A day (December 28) observed by mass or festival in commemoration of the children slain by Herod at Bethlehem; -- called also Holy Innocent's Day.
crull : (a.) Curly; curled.
confrmed : (imp. & p. p.) of Confirm
contestation : (n.) The act of contesting; emulation; rivalry; strife; dispute. | : (n.) Proof by witness; attestation; testimony.
chalybeate : (a.) Impregnated with salts of iron; having a taste like iron; as, chalybeate springs. | : (n.) Any water, liquid, or medicine, into which iron enters as an ingredient.
contrafagetto : (n.) The double bassoon, an octave deeper than the bassoon.
crumb : (n.) A small fragment or piece; especially, a small piece of bread or other food, broken or cut off. | : (n.) Fig.: A little; a bit; as, a crumb of comfort. | : (n.) The soft part of bread. | : (v. t.) To break into crumbs or small pieces with the fingers; as, to crumb bread.
cudgel : (n.) A staff used in cudgel play, shorter than the quarterstaff, and wielded with one hand; hence, any heavy stick used as a weapon. | : (v. t.) To beat with a cudgel.
calcic : (a.) Pertaining to, derived from, or containing, calcium or lime.
correctress : (n.) A woman who corrects.
christianlike : (a.) Becoming to a Christian.
cottonade : (n.) A somewhat stout and thick fabric of cotton.
certified : (imp. & p. p.) of Certify
chaetopod : (a.) Pertaining to the Chaetopoda. | : (n.) One of the Chaetopoda.
calendulin : (n.) A gummy or mucilaginous tasteless substance obtained from the marigold or calendula, and analogous to bassorin.
courbaril : (n.) See Anime, n.
colliquative : (a.) Causing rapid waste or exhaustion; melting; as, colliquative sweats.
campeachy wood : ( ) Logwood.
centrally : (adv.) In a central manner or situation.
caning : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Cane
canine : (a.) Of or pertaining to the family Canidae, or dogs and wolves; having the nature or qualities of a dog; like that or those of a dog. | : (a.) Of or pertaining to the pointed tooth on each side the incisors. | : (n.) A canine tooth.
cataphracted : (a.) Covered with a cataphract, or armor of plates, scales, etc.; or with that which corresponds to this, as horny or bony plates, hard, callous skin, etc.
chinchona : ( ) Alt. of Chincona
chewed : (imp. & p. p.) of Chew
checkerboard : (n.) A board with sixty-four squares of alternate color, used for playing checkers or draughts.
comprehensibleness : (n.) The quality of being comprehensible; comprehensibility.
culminant : (a.) Being vertical, or at the highest point of altitude; hence, predominant.
corival : (n.) A rival; a corrival. | : (v. t.) To rival; to pretend to equal.
capote : (n.) A long cloak or overcoat, especially one with a hood.
consumable : (a.) Capable of being consumed; that may be destroyed, dissipated, wasted, or spent.
cellos : (pl. ) of Cello
cribbage : (v. t.) A game of cards, played by two or four persons, in which there is a crib. (See Crib, 11.) It is characterized by a great variety of chances.
cosmometry : (n.) The art of measuring the world or the universe.
confervoid : (a.) Like, or related to, the confervae.
contradictories : (pl. ) of Contradictory
confuting : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Confute
coheirship : (n.) The state of being a coheir.
carbonatation : (n.) The saturation of defecated beet juice with carbonic acid gas.
cringer : (n.) One who cringes.
crateriform : (a.) Having the form of a shallow bowl; -- said of a corolla.
catbird : (n.) An American bird (Galeoscoptes Carolinensis), allied to the mocking bird, and like it capable of imitating the notes of other birds, but less perfectly. Its note resembles at times the mewing of a cat.
consortship : (n.) The condition of a consort; fellowship; partnership.
casus : (n.) An event; an occurrence; an occasion; a combination of circumstances; a case; an act of God. See the Note under Accident.
chaining : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Chain
copaiva : (n.) A more or less viscid, yellowish liquid, the bitter oleoresin of several species of Copaifera, a genus of trees growing in South America and the West Indies. It is stimulant and diuretic, and is much used in affections of the mucous membranes; -- called also balsam of copaiba.
coulee : (n.) A stream | : (n.) a stream of lava. Also, in the Western United States, the bed of a stream, even if dry, when deep and having inclined sides; distinguished from a caon, which has precipitous sides.
calorification : (n.) Production of heat, esp. animal heat.
climatologist : (n.) One versed in, or who studies, climatology.
commodiously : (adv.) In a commodious manner.
cruel : (n.) See Crewel. | : (a.) Disposed to give pain to others; willing or pleased to hurt, torment, or afflict; destitute of sympathetic kindness and pity; savage; inhuman; hard-hearted; merciless. | : (a.) Causing, or fitted to cause, pain, grief, or misery. | : (a.) Attended with cruetly; painful; harsh.
caste : (n.) One of the hereditary classes into which the Hindoos are divided according to the laws of Brahmanism. | : (n.) A separate and fixed order or class of persons in society who chiefly hold intercourse among themselves.
capping : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Cap
cardinal : (a.) Of fundamental importance; preeminent; superior; chief; principal. | : (a.) One of the ecclesiastical princes who constitute the pope's council, or the sacred college. | : (a.) A woman's short cloak with a hood. | : (a.) Mulled red wine.
clypeus : (n.) The frontal plate of the head of an insect.
conditioning : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Condition
concussion : (n.) A shaking or agitation; a shock; caused by the collision of two bodies. | : (n.) A condition of lowered functional activity, without visible structural change, produced in an organ by a shock, as by fall or blow; as, a concussion of the brain. | : (n.) The unlawful forcing of another by threats of violence to yield up something of value.
cruet : (n.) A bottle or vessel; esp., a vial or small glass bottle for holding vinegar, oil, pepper, or the like, for the table; a caster. | : (n.) A vessel used to hold wine, oil, or water for the service of the altar.
cynical : (a.) Having the qualities of a surly dog; snarling; captious; currish. | : (a.) Pertaining to the Dog Star; as, the cynic, or Sothic, year; cynic cycle. | : (a.) Belonging to the sect of philosophers called cynics; having the qualities of a cynic; pertaining to, or resembling, the doctrines of the cynics. | : (a.) Given to sneering at rectitude and the conduct of life by moral principles; disbelieving in the reality of any human purposes which are not suggested or directed by self-interest or self-indulgence; as, a cynical man who scoffs at pretensions of integrity; characterized by such opinions; as, cynical views of human nature.
catheter : (n.) The name of various instruments for passing along mucous canals, esp. applied to a tubular instrument to be introduced into the bladder through the urethra to draw off the urine.
chimney : (n.) A fireplace or hearth. | : (n.) That part of a building which contains the smoke flues; esp. an upright tube or flue of brick or stone, in most cases extending through or above the roof of the building. Often used instead of chimney shaft. | : (n.) A tube usually of glass, placed around a flame, as of a lamp, to create a draft, and promote combustion. | : (n.) A body of ore, usually of elongated form, extending downward in a vein.
candidly : (adv.) In a candid manner.
culminate : (v. i.) To reach its highest point of altitude; to come to the meridian; to be vertical or directly overhead. | : (v. i.) To reach the highest point, as of rank, size, power, numbers, etc. | : (a.) Growing upward, as distinguished from a lateral growth; -- applied to the growth of corals.
carbonide : (n.) A carbide.
choriamb : (n.) Same as Choriambus.
cervicide : (n.) The act of killing deer; deer-slaying.
coachmanship : (n.) Skill in driving a coach.
commendatory : (a.) Serving to commend; containing praise or commendation; commending; praising. | : (a.) Holding a benefice in commendam; as, a commendatory bishop. | : (n.) A commendation; eulogy.
consentingly : (adv.) With consent; in a compliant manner.
coadjutant : (a.) Mutually assisting or operating; helping. | : (n.) An assistant.
commixture : (n.) The act or process of mixing; the state of being mingled; the blending of ingredients in one mass or compound. | : (n.) The mass formed by mingling different things; a compound; a mixture.
copygraph : (n.) A contrivance for producing manifold copies of a writing or drawing.
cowage : (n.) See Cowhage.
criosphinx : (n.) A sphinx with the head of a ram.
crazing : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Craze
cornutor : (n.) A cuckold maker.
capitalist : (n.) One who has capital; one who has money for investment, or money invested; esp. a person of large property, which is employed in business.
corniplume : (n.) A hornlike tuft of feathers on the head of some birds.
cowrie : (n.) Same as Kauri. | : (n.) Alt. of Cowry
capabilities : (pl. ) of Capability
cryptonym : (n.) A secret name; a name by which a person is known only to the initiated.
cockroach : (n.) An orthopterous insect of the genus Blatta, and allied genera.
cippus : (n.) A small, low pillar, square or round, commonly having an inscription, used by the ancients for various purposes, as for indicating the distances of places, for a landmark, for sepulchral inscriptions, etc.
chiefly : (adv.) In the first place; principally; preeminently; above; especially. | : (adv.) For the most part; mostly.
coralline : (a.) Composed of corallines; as, coralline limestone. | : (n.) A submarine, semicalcareous or calcareous plant, consisting of many jointed branches. | : (n.) Formerly any slender coral-like animal; -- sometimes applied more particulary to bryozoan corals.
crazily : (adv.) In a crazy manner.
coxcomically : (adv.) Conceitedly.
cutthroat : (n.) One who cuts throats; a murderer; an assassin. | : (a.) Murderous; cruel; barbarous.
congou : (n.) Alt. of Congo
counter-couchant : (a.) Lying down, with their heads in opposite directions; -- said of animals borne in a coat of arms.
circumflant : (a.) Blowing around.
crooking : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Crook
counterweigh : (v. t.) To weigh against; to counterbalance.
capitularly : (adv.) In the manner or form of an ecclesiastical chapter.
cabineting : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Cabinet
cuvette : (n.) A pot, bucket, or basin, in which molten plate glass is carried from the melting pot to the casting table. | : (n.) A cunette. | : (n.) A small vessel with at least two flat and transparent sides, used to hold a liquid sample to be analysed in the light path of a spectrometer.
capacify : (v. t.) To quality.
chantries : (pl. ) of Chantry
contributory : (a.) Contributing to the same stock or purpose; promoting the same end; bringing assistance to some joint design, or increase to some common stock; contributive. | : (n.) One who contributes, or is liable to be called upon to contribute, as toward the discharge of a common indebtedness.
convival : (a.) pertaining to a feast or to festivity; convivial.
career : (n.) A race course: the ground run over. | : (n.) A running; full speed; a rapid course. | : (n.) General course of action or conduct in life, or in a particular part or calling in life, or in some special undertaking; usually applied to course or conduct which is of a public character; as, Washington's career as a soldier. | : (n.) The flight of a hawk. | : (v. i.) To move or run rapidly.
compotation : (n.) The act of drinking or tippling together.
copyright : (n.) The right of an author or his assignee, under statute, to print and publish his literary or artistic work, exclusively of all other persons. This right may be had in maps, charts, engravings, plays, and musical compositions, as well as in books. | : (v. t.) To secure a copyright on.
catchpoll : (n.) A bailiff's assistant.
compacting : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Compact
counterturn : (n.) The critical moment in a play, when, contrary to expectation, the action is embroiled in new difficulties.
carpeting : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Carpet | : (n.) The act of covering with carpets. | : (n.) Cloth or materials for carpets; carpets, in general.
careen : (v. t.) To cause (a vessel) to lean over so that she floats on one side, leaving the other side out of water and accessible for repairs below the water line; to case to be off the keel. | : (v. i.) To incline to one side, or lie over, as a ship when sailing on a wind; to be off the keel.
canalization : (n.) Construction of, or furnishing with, a canal or canals.
choring : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Chore
coranto : (n.) A sprightly but somewhat stately dance, now out of fashion.
cumin : (n.) A dwarf umbelliferous plant, somewhat resembling fennel (Cuminum Cyminum), cultivated for its seeds, which have a bitterish, warm taste, with an aromatic flavor, and are used like those of anise and caraway.
couple-close : (n.) A diminutive of the chevron, containing one fourth of its surface. Couple-closes are generally borne one on each side of a chevron, and the blazoning may then be either a chevron between two couple-closes or chevron cottised. | : (n.) A pair of rafters framed together with a tie fixed at their feet, or with a collar beam.
cuniform : (a.) Wedge-shaped; as, a cuneiform bone; -- especially applied to the wedge-shaped or arrowheaded characters of ancient Persian and Assyrian inscriptions. See Arrowheaded. | : (a.) Pertaining to, or versed in, the ancient wedge-shaped characters, or the inscriptions in them. | : (n.) The wedge-shaped characters used in ancient Persian and Assyrian inscriptions. | : (n.) One of the three tarsal bones supporting the first, second third metatarsals. They are usually designated as external, middle, and internal, or ectocuniform, mesocuniform, and entocuniform, respectively. | : (n.) One of the carpal bones usually articulating with the ulna; -- called also pyramidal and ulnare.
cacodemon : (n.) An evil spirit; a devil or demon. | : (n.) The nightmare.
catechist : (n.) One who instructs by question and answer, especially in religions matters.
conceptionalist : (n.) A conceptualist.
chesstree : (n.) A piece of oak bolted perpendicularly on the side of a vessel, to aid in drawing down and securing the clew of the mainsail.
contemplatively : (adv.) With contemplation; in a contemplative manner.
corporator : (n.) A member of a corporation, esp. one of the original members.
cantilena : (n.) See Cantabile.
chromate : (n.) A salt of chromic acid.
catechism : (n.) A form of instruction by means of questions and answers. | : (n.) A book containing a summary of principles, especially of religious doctrine, reduced to the form of questions and answers.
clypeiform : (a.) Shield-shaped; clypeate.
cirrate : (a.) Having cirri along the margin of a part or organ.
cobourg : (n.) A thin worsted fabric for women's dresses.
colliquament : (n.) The first rudiments of an embryo in generation.
cardiographic : (a.) Of or pertaining to, or produced by, a cardiograph.
catechise : (v. t.) To instruct by asking questions, receiving answers, and offering explanations and corrections, -- esp. in regard to points of religious faith. | : (v. t.) To question or interrogate; to examine or try by questions; -- sometimes with a view to reproof, by eliciting from a person answers which condemn his own conduct.
consignature : (n.) Joint signature.
cyanuret : (n.) A cyanide.
cephalopodous : (a.) Belonging to, or resembling, the cephalopods.
cool-headed : (a.) Having a temper not easily excited; free from passion.
cormophyta : (n. pl.) A term proposed by Endlicher to include all plants with an axis containing vascular tissue and with foliage.
cosmoplastic : (a.) Pertaining to a plastic force as operative in the formation of the world independently of God; world-forming.
cypraea : (n.) A genus of mollusks, including the cowries. See Cowrie.
centuplicate : (a.) To make a hundredfold; to repeat a hundred times.
crossing : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Cross | : (v. t.) The act by which anything is crossed; as, the crossing of the ocean. | : (v. t.) The act of making the sign of the cross. | : (v. t.) The act of interbreeding; a mixing of breeds. | : (v. t.) Intersection, as of two paths or roads. | : (v. t.) A place where anything (as a stream) is crossed; a paved walk across a street. | : (v. t.) Contradiction; thwarting; obstruction.
cuckold's knot : ( ) A hitch or knot, by which a rope is secured to a spar, the two parts of the rope being crossed and seized together; -- called also cuckold's neck.
circumnavigation : (n.) The act of circumnavigating, or sailing round.
complexed : (a.) Complex, complicated.
chasuble : (n.) The outer vestment worn by the priest in saying Mass, consisting, in the Roman Catholic Church, of a broad, flat, back piece, and a narrower front piece, the two connected over the shoulders only. The back has usually a large cross, the front an upright bar or pillar, designed to be emblematical of Christ's sufferings. In the Greek Church the chasuble is a large round mantle.
carver : (n.) One who carves; one who shapes or fashions by carving, or as by carving; esp. one who carves decorative forms, architectural adornments, etc. | : (n.) One who carves or divides meat at table. | : (n.) A large knife for carving.
cinque-spotted : (a.) Five-spotted.
connector : (n.) One who, or that which, connects | : (n.) A flexible tube for connecting the ends of glass tubes in pneumatic experiments. | : (n.) A device for holding two parts of an electrical conductor in contact.
camomile : (n.) Alt. of Chamomile
carvel : (n.) Same as Caravel. | : (n.) A species of jellyfish; sea blubber.
cross-examining : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Cross-examine
cabob : (n.) A small piece of mutton or other meat roasted on a skewer; -- so called in Turkey and Persia. | : (n.) A leg of mutton roasted, stuffed with white herrings and sweet herbs. | : (v. t.) To roast, as a cabob.
carven : (a.) Wrought by carving; ornamented by carvings; carved.
circumvolve : (v. t.) To roll round; to cause to revolve; to put into a circular motion. | : (v. i.) To roll round; to revolve.
cumulatist : (n.) One who accumulates; one who collects.
circumscribe : (v. t.) to write or engrave around. | : (v. t.) To inclose within a certain limit; to hem in; to surround; to bound; to confine; to restrain. | : (v. t.) To draw a line around so as to touch at certain points without cutting. See Inscribe, 5.
crossed : (imp. & p. p.) of Cross
cumic : (a.) See Cuming.
carved : (imp. & p. p.) of Carve
creviced : (a.) Having a crevice or crevices; as, a creviced structure for storing ears of corn.
cytogeny : (n .) Cell production or development; cytogenesis.
chandlery : (n.) Commodities sold by a chandler.
catkin : (n.) An ament; a species of inflorescence, consisting of a slender axis with many unisexual apetalous flowers along its sides, as in the willow and poplar, and (as to the staminate flowers) in the chestnut, oak, hickory, etc. -- so called from its resemblance to a cat's tail. See Illust. of Ament.
contrayerva : (n.) A species of Dorstenia (D. Contrayerva), a South American plant, the aromatic root of which is sometimes used in medicine as a gentle stimulant and tonic.
cyclopaedia : (n.) The circle or compass of the arts and sciences (originally, of the seven so-called liberal arts and sciences); circle of human knowledge. Hence, a work containing, in alphabetical order, information in all departments of knowledge, or on a particular department or branch; as, a cyclopedia of the physical sciences, or of mechanics. See Encyclopedia.
crude : (superl.) In its natural state; not cooked or prepared by fire or heat; undressed; not altered, refined, or prepared for use by any artificial process; raw; as, crude flesh. | : (superl.) Unripe; not mature or perfect; immature. | : (superl.) Not reduced to order or form; unfinished; not arranged or prepared; ill-considered; immature. | : (superl.) Undigested; unconcocted; not brought into a form to give nourishment. | : (superl.) Having, or displaying, superficial and undigested knowledge; without culture or profundity; as, a crude reasoner. | : (superl.) Harsh and offensive, as a color; tawdry or in bad taste, as a combination of colors, or any design or work of art.
corallian : (n.) A deposit of coralliferous limestone forming a portion of the middle division of the oolite; -- called also coral-rag.
crudy : (a.) Coagulated. | : (a.) Characterized by crudeness; raw.
cottager : (n.) One who lives in a cottage. | : (n.) One who lives on the common, without paying any rent, or having land of his own.
corybants : (pl. ) of Corybant
cashew : (n.) A tree (Anacardium occidentale) of the same family which the sumac. It is native in tropical America, but is now naturalized in all tropical countries. Its fruit, a kidney-shaped nut, grows at the extremity of an edible, pear-shaped hypocarp, about three inches long.
cottaged : (a.) Set or covered with cottages.
compesce : (v. t.) To hold in check; to restrain.
concierge : (n.) One who keeps the entrance to an edifice, public or private; a doorkeeper; a janitor, male or female.
coronation : (n.) The act or solemnity of crowning a sovereign; the act of investing a prince with the insignia of royalty, on his succeeding to the sovereignty. | : (n.) The pomp or assembly at a coronation.
circumgyration : (n.) The act of turning, rolling, or whirling round.
cohere : (a.) To stick together; to cleave; to be united; to hold fast, as parts of the same mass. | : (a.) To be united or connected together in subordination to one purpose; to follow naturally and logically, as the parts of a discourse, or as arguments in a train of reasoning; to be logically consistent. | : (a.) To suit; to agree; to fit.
congratulated : (imp. & p. p.) of Congratulate
cabalistically : (adv.) In a cabalistic manner.
cyclopic : (a.) Pertaining to the Cyclops; Cyclopean.
clustered : (imp. & p. p.) of Cluster
cession : (n.) A yielding to physical force. | : (n.) Concession; compliance. | : (n.) A yielding, or surrender, as of property or rights, to another person; the act of ceding. | : (n.) The giving up or vacating a benefice by accepting another without a proper dispensation. | : (n.) The voluntary surrender of a person's effects to his creditors to avoid imprisonment.
cunningness : (n.) Quality of being cunning; craft.
cumulative : (a.) Composed of parts in a heap; forming a mass; aggregated. | : (a.) Augmenting, gaining, or giving force, by successive additions; as, a cumulative argument, i. e., one whose force increases as the statement proceeds. | : (a.) Tending to prove the same point to which other evidence has been offered; -- said of evidence. | : (a.) Given by same testator to the same legatee; -- said of a legacy.
case shot : ( ) A collection of small projectiles, inclosed in a case or canister.
churchdom : (n.) The institution, government, or authority of a church.
crapulent : (a.) Alt. of Crapulous
cashed : (imp. & p. p.) of Cash
chromospheric : (a.) Of or pertaining to the chromosphere.
comprehending : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Comprehend
circumnavigating : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Circumnavigate
conduciveness : (n.) The quality of conducing.
communalistic : (a.) Pertaining to communalism.
chaptrel : (n.) An impost.
cortege : (n.) A train of attendants; a procession.
cerebrose : (n.) A sugarlike body obtained by the decomposition of the nitrogenous non-phosphorized principles of the brain.
creolean : (a.) Alt. of Creolian
commentaries : (pl. ) of Commentary
capped : (imp. & p. p.) of Cap
celticize : (v. t.) To render Celtic; to assimilate to the Celts.
contrivement : (n.) Contrivance; invention; arrangement; design; plan.
chronometry : (n.) The art of measuring time; the measuring of time by periods or divisions.
concussive : (a.) Having the power or quality of shaking or agitating.
cessing : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Cess
chiasm : (n.) Alt. of Chiasma
cat's-foot : (n.) A plant (Nepeta Glechoma) of the same genus with catnip; ground ivy.

caecums : (pl. ) of Caecum
clumpy : (n.) Composed of clumps; massive; shapeless.
constancy : (n.) The state or quality of being constant or steadfast; freedom from change; stability; fixedness; immutability; as, the constancy of God in his nature and attributes. | : (n.) Fixedness or firmness of mind; persevering resolution; especially, firmness of mind under sufferings, steadiness in attachments, or perseverance in enterprise; stability; fidelity.
countretaille : (n.) A counter tally; correspondence (in sound).
conclusiveness : (n.) The quality of being conclusive; decisiveness.
crustaceology : (n.) That branch of Zoology which treats of the Crustacea; malacostracology; carcinology.
calaverite : (n.) A bronze-yellow massive mineral with metallic luster; a telluride of gold; -- first found in Calaveras County California.
coadjutrix : (n.) A female coadjutor or assistant.
condensability : (n.) Capability of being condensed.
clumps : (n.) A game in which questions are asked for the purpose of enabling the questioners to discover a word or thing previously selected by two persons who answer the questions; -- so called because the players take sides in two "clumps" or groups, the "clump" which guesses the word winning the game.
cable : (n.) A large, strong rope or chain, of considerable length, used to retain a vessel at anchor, and for other purposes. It is made of hemp, of steel wire, or of iron links. | : (n.) A rope of steel wire, or copper wire, usually covered with some protecting or insulating substance; as, the cable of a suspension bridge; a telegraphic cable. | : (n.) A molding, shaft of a column, or any other member of convex, rounded section, made to resemble the spiral twist of a rope; -- called also cable molding. | : (v. t.) To fasten with a cable. | : (v. t.) To ornament with cabling. See Cabling. | : (v. t. & i.) To telegraph by a submarine cable
catching : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Catch | : (a.) Infectious; contagious. | : (a.) Captivating; alluring. | : (n.) The act of seizing or taking hold of.
choralist : (n.) A singer or composer of chorals.
correligionist : (n.) A co-religion/ist.
chloriodine : (n.) A compound of chlorine and iodine.
cypripedium : (n.) A genus of orchidaceous plants including the lady's slipper.
chevachie : (n.) See Chivachie.
caveating : (n.) Shifting the sword from one side of an adversary's sword to the other.
conger : (n.) The conger eel; -- called also congeree.
contriturate : (v. t.) To triturate; to pulverize.
continuance : (n.) A holding on, or remaining in a particular state; permanence, as of condition, habits, abode, etc.; perseverance; constancy; duration; stay. | : (n.) Uninterrupted succession; continuation; constant renewal; perpetuation; propagation. | : (n.) A holding together; continuity. | : (n.) The adjournment of the proceedings in a cause from one day, or from one stated term of a court, to another. | : (n.) The entry of such adjournment and the grounds thereof on the record.
cataphysical : (a.) Unnatural; contrary to nature.
concludent : (a.) Bringing to a close; decisive; conclusive.
congee : (n. & v.) See Conge, Conge. | : (n.) Boiled rice; rice gruel. | : (n.) A jail; a lockup.
cumulation : (n.) The act of heaping together; a heap. See Accumulation.
christianization : (n.) The act or process of converting or being converted to a true Christianity.
converging : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Converge | : (a.) Tending to one point; approaching each other; convergent; as, converging lines.
cacophonious : (a.) Harsh-sounding.
cerotin : (n.) A white crystalline substance, C27H55.OH, obtained from Chinese wax, and regarded as an alcohol of the marsh gas series; -- called also cerotic alcohol, ceryl alcohol.
carting : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Cart
categoricalness : (n.) The quality of being categorical, positive, or absolute.
chock-full : (a.) Quite full; choke-full.
competible : (a.) Compatible; suitable; consistent.
calendared : (imp. & p. p.) of Calendar
cirrobranchiata : (n. pl.) A division of Mollusca having slender, cirriform appendages near the mouth; the Scaphopoda.
cerotic : (a.) Pertaining to, or derived from, beeswax or Chinese wax; as, cerotic acid or alcohol.
christcross-row : ( ) The alphabet; -- formerly so called, either from the cross usually set before it, or from a superstitious custom, sometimes practiced, of writing it in the form of a cross, by way of a charm.
corrigendum : (n.) A fault or error to be corrected.
cold-blooded : (a.) Having cold blood; -- said of fish or animals whose blood is but little warmer than the water or air about them. | : (a.) Deficient in sensibility or feeling; hard-hearted. | : (a.) Not thoroughbred; -- said of animals, as horses, which are derived from the common stock of a country.
communicability : (n.) The quality of being communicable; capability of being imparted.
conodont : (n.) A peculiar toothlike fossil of many forms, found especially in carboniferous rocks. Such fossils are supposed by some to be the teeth of marsipobranch fishes, but they are probably the jaws of annelids.
coastways : (adv.) By way of, or along, the coast.
cooptate : (v. t.) To choose; to elect; to coopt.
chirre : (v. i.) To coo, as a pigeon.
cothurnated : (a.) Wearing a cothurn. | : (a.) Relating to tragedy; solemn; grave.
cubbridge-head : (n.) A bulkhead on the forecastle and half deck of a ship.
coating : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Coat | : (n.) A coat or covering; a layer of any substance, as a cover or protection; as, the coating of a retort or vial. | : (n.) Cloth for coats; as, an assortment of coatings.
contradictorily : (adv.) In a contradictory manner.
crevalle : (n.) The cavally or jurel. | : (n.) The pompano (Trachynotus Carolinus).
cannabin : (n.) A poisonous resin extracted from hemp (Cannabis sativa, variety Indica). The narcotic effects of hasheesh are due to this resin.
copperplate : (n.) A plate of polished copper on which a design or writing is engraved. | : (n.) An impression on paper taken from such a plate.
conceptive : (a.) Capable of conceiving.
cannabis : (n.) A genus of a single species belonging to the order Uricaceae; hemp.
carboniferous : (a.) Producing or containing carbon or coal.
cacophony : (n.) An uncouth or disagreable sound of words, owing to the concurrence of harsh letters or syllables. | : (n.) A combination of discordant sounds. | : (n.) An unhealthy state of the voice.
culasse : (n.) The lower faceted portion of a brilliant-cut diamond.
cenobite : (n.) One of a religious order, dwelling in a convent, or a community, in opposition to an anchoret, or hermit, who lives in solitude.
consecrating : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Consecrate
crepuscle : (n.) Alt. of Crepuscule
quarte : (n.) A position in thrusting or parrying, with the inside of the hand turned upward and the point of the weapon toward the adversary's right breast.
coelentera : (n. pl.) Alt. of Coelenterata
coarct : (a.) Alt. of Coarctate
chapeux : (pl. ) of Chapeau
catechize : (v. t.) See Catechise.
complacently : (adv.) In a complacent manner.
cachucha : (n.) An Andalusian dance in three-four time, resembling the bolero.
clumsy : (superl.) Stiff or benumbed, as with cold. | : (superl.) Without skill or grace; wanting dexterity, nimbleness, or readiness; stiff; awkward, as if benumbed; unwieldy; unhandy; hence; ill-made, misshapen, or inappropriate; as, a clumsy person; a clumsy workman; clumsy fingers; a clumsy gesture; a clumsy excuse.
comedown : (n.) A downfall; an humiliation.
contraindicated : (imp. & p. p.) of Contraindicate
commode : (n.) A kind of headdress formerly worn by ladies, raising the hair and fore part of the cap to a great height. | : (n.) A piece of furniture, so named according to temporary fashion | : (n.) A chest of drawers or a bureau. | : (n.) A night stand with a compartment for holding a chamber vessel. | : (n.) A kind of close stool. | : (n.) A movable sink or stand for a wash bowl, with closet.
corbel : (n.) A bracket supporting a superincumbent object, or receiving the spring of an arch. Corbels were employed largely in Gothic architecture. | : (v. t.) To furnish with a corbel or corbels; to support by a corbel; to make in the form of a corbel.
capitulation : (n.) A reducing to heads or articles; a formal agreement. | : (n.) The act of capitulating or surrendering to an emeny upon stipulated terms. | : (n.) The instrument containing the terms of an agreement or surrender.
chaunter : (n.) A street seller of ballads and other broadsides. | : (n.) A deceitful, tricky dealer or horse jockey. | : (n.) The flute of a bagpipe. See Chanter, n., 3.
countenancing : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Countenance
consecration : (n.) The act or ceremony of consecrating; the state of being consecrated; dedication.
corpuscule : (n.) A corpuscle.
cheese : (n.) The curd of milk, coagulated usually with rennet, separated from the whey, and pressed into a solid mass in a hoop or mold. | : (n.) A mass of pomace, or ground apples, pressed together in the form of a cheese. | : (n.) The flat, circular, mucilaginous fruit of the dwarf mallow (Malva rotundifolia). | : (n.) A low courtesy; -- so called on account of the cheese form assumed by a woman's dress when she stoops after extending the skirts by a rapid gyration.
cheventein : (n.) A variant of Chieftain.
choicely : (adv.) With care in choosing; with nice regard to preference. | : (adv.) In a preferable or excellent manner; excellently; eminently.
cottonary : (a.) Relating to, or composed of, cotton; cottony.
clanking : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Clank
chimerical : (a.) Merely imaginary; fanciful; fantastic; wildly or vainly conceived; having, or capable of having, no existence except in thought; as, chimerical projects.
congealable : (a.) Capable of being congealed.
cache : (n.) A hole in the ground, or hiding place, for concealing and preserving provisions which it is inconvenient to carry.
copulative : (a.) Serving to couple, unite, or connect; as, a copulative conjunction like "and". | : (n.) Connection. | : (n.) A copulative conjunction.
congealment : (n.) The act or the process of congealing; congeliation. | : (n.) That which is formed by congelation; a clot.
catafalque : (n.) A temporary structure sometimes used in the funeral solemnities of eminent persons, for the public exhibition of the remains, or their conveyance to the place of burial.
congenital : (a.) Existing at, or dating from, birth; pertaining to one from birth; born with one; connate; constitutional; natural; as, a congenital deformity. See Connate.
chaired : (imp. & p. pr.) of Chair
collaterally : (adv.) Side by side; by the side. | : (adv.) In an indirect or subordinate manner; indirectly. | : (adv.) In collateral relation; not lineally.
cantrap : (n.) Alt. of Cantrip
confound : (v. t.) To mingle and blend, so that different elements can not be distinguished; to confuse. | : (v. t.) To mistake for another; to identify falsely. | : (v. t.) To throw into confusion or disorder; to perplex; to strike with amazement; to dismay. | : (v. t.) To destroy; to ruin; to waste.
cherubs : (pl. ) of Cherub
cheesy : (a.) Having the nature, qualities, taste, form, consistency, or appearance of cheese.
confutation : (n.) The act or process of confuting; refutation.
crimping : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Crimp
cloaking : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Cloak | : (n.) The act of covering with a cloak; the act of concealing anything. | : (n.) The material of which of which cloaks are made.
coaxingly : (adv.) In a coaxing manner; by coaxing.
crossflow : (v. i.) To flow across, or in a contrary direction.
carbimide : (n.) The technical name for isocyanic acid. See under Isocyanic.
caducibranchiate : (a.) With temporary gills: -- applied to those Amphibia in which the gills do not remain in adult life.
